sentences.chinese: 然而，在向美国和世界宣布这个消息时，奥巴马却显的小心谨慎，没有表现出一点幸灾乐祸，因为他的前任乔治·布什任期内没有完成的事情被他完成了。

sentences.english: It is easy to gloat when the cool jock with the hot girlfriend wrecks his sweet car, especially if he seems kind of smug.
sentences.chinese: 当酷酷的大学运动员和热辣的女友坐他的爱车失事后，特别是这人有些自以为是，那么幸灾乐祸的想法是很自然会产生的。

name: hesitate
trans: vi. 踌躇，犹豫；不愿 vt. 踌躇，犹豫；有疑虑，不愿意

sentences.english: I hesitate.
sentences.chinese: 我犹豫。

detailed_translations.english: to be slow to speak or act because you feel uncertain or nervous

name: slump
trans: v. （价格、数量等）骤降；重重地坐下（或倒下）；惨败；（肩或脑袋）耷拉着 n. （价格、数量等的）猛然严重下降；经济不景气时期；低潮期

sentences.english: Sales slumped by 20% last year.
sentences.chinese: 去年销售额骤减 20%。

sentences.english: The council's land is now worth much less than originally hoped because of a slump in property prices.
sentences.chinese: 由于地产价格的暴跌，委员会的土地目前大不如原来所希望的那么值钱了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 下降，衰落；倒下；大幅度下降，暴跌
detailed_translations.english: to fall or lean against something because you are not strong enough to stand
Slump is also a noun

name: sly
trans: adj. 狡猾的；淘气的；诡密的 n. (Sly)人名；(英)斯莱

sentences.english: He leaned forward with a sly smile.
sentences.chinese: 他俯身向前诡秘地一笑。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is sly cleverly deceives people in order to get what they want

name: smirk
trans: v. 得意地笑，幸灾乐祸地笑，傻笑；假笑；以假笑表示，以傻笑表示 n. 傻笑，得意的笑；假笑

sentences.english: The boys tried not to smirk.
sentences.chinese: 男孩们强忍住得意的笑。

detailed_translations.english: to smile in an unpleasant way that shows that you are pleased by someone else’s bad luck or think you are better than other people

name: urge
trans: vt. 力劝，催促；驱策，推进 n. 强烈的欲望，迫切要求；推动力 vi. 强烈要求

sentences.english: The charity urged quick action.
sentences.chinese: 慈善机构敦促迅速采取行动。

sentences.english: I got a note from Moira urging me to get in touch.
sentences.chinese: 我收到莫伊拉的一封短信，一定要我保持联系。

detailed_translations.english: to strongly suggest that someone does something

name: distance
trans: n. 距离；远方；疏远；间隔 vt. 疏远；把…远远甩在后面

sentences.english: Measure the distance between the two points.
sentences.chinese: 量出两点之间的距离。

sentences.english: The cottage is some distance (= quite a long distance ) from the road.
sentences.chinese: 小屋离开大路有些距离。

sentences.english: Church bells rang in the distance (= they were far away ) .
sentences.chinese: 远处教堂的钟声响起。

detailed_translations.english: the amount of space between two places or things

name: layer
trans: n. 层，层次；膜；[植]压条；放置者，计划者 vt. 把…分层堆放；借助压条法；生根繁殖；将（头发）剪成不同层次 vi. 形成或分成层次；[植]通过压条法而生根

sentences.english: He pulled off layer upon layer of clothing (= many layers of clothing ).
sentences.chinese: 他把衣服一件件地脱掉。

detailed_translations.english: an amount or piece of a material or substance that covers a surface or that is between two other things

name: protect
trans: vt. 保护，防卫；警戒

sentences.english: Are we doing enough to protect the environment?
sentences.chinese: 我们在保护环境方面做得够吗？

detailed_translations.english: to keep someone or something safe from harm, damage, or illness

name: ridge
trans: n. 山脊；山脉；屋脊 vt. 使成脊状；作垄 vi. 成脊状 n. (Ridge)人名；(英)里奇

sentences.english: We made our way carefully along the ridge.
sentences.chinese: 我们沿着山脊小心前行。

detailed_translations.english: a long area of high land, especially at the top of a mountain

name: warn
trans: vt. 警告，提醒；通知 vi. 发出警告，发出预告 n. (Warn)人名；(英)沃恩；(德)瓦恩

sentences.english: ‘Be careful, the rocks are slippery,’ Alex warned.
sentences.chinese: “小心，岩石很滑。”亚历克斯提醒说。

detailed_translations.english: to tell someone that something bad or dangerous may happen, so that they can avoid it or prevent it

name: adopt
trans: vt. 采取；接受；收养；正式通过 vi. 采取；过继

sentences.english: The courts were asked to adopt a more flexible approach to young offenders.
sentences.chinese: 法庭被要求对少年犯采取更为灵活的处理方法。

sentences.english: The store recently adopted a drug testing policy for all new employees.
sentences.chinese: 这家商店近来实行新雇员一律要做药检的政策。

sentences.english: California has adopted a tough stance on the issue.
sentences.chinese: 加利福尼亚州对这一问题持强硬立场。

detailed_translations.english: to start to deal with or think about something in a particular way

name: injury
trans: n. 伤害，损害；受伤处

sentences.english: She was taken to hospital with serious head injuries.
sentences.chinese: 她头部受重伤被送到医院。

sentences.english: Beckham has missed several games through injury
sentences.chinese: 贝克汉姆因伤错过了几场比赛。

sentences.english: He’s a lawyer who specializes in personal injury claims.
sentences.chinese: 他是个专门从事人身伤害索赔的律师。

detailed_translations.english: a wound or damage to part of your body caused by an accident or attack

name: investigate
trans: v. 调查；研究

sentences.english: The state police are investigating the incident.
sentences.chinese: 州警察正调查此事。

sentences.english: The study investigates the impact of violent TV programming on children.
sentences.chinese: 该研究调查暴力电视节目对儿童的影响。

sentences.english: I heard a noise and went downstairs to investigate.
sentences.chinese: 我听见响声，就下楼去看个究竟。

detailed_translations.english: to try to find out the truth about something such as a crime, accident, or scientific problem

name: mascot
trans: n. 吉祥物；福神（等于mascotte） n. (Mascot)人名；(法)马斯科

sentences.english: the official mascot of the 2002 World Cup
sentences.chinese: 2002年世界杯的官方吉祥物

sentences.english: Rocky the Raccoon, the team mascot
sentences.chinese: 浣熊罗基，该队的吉祥物

detailed_translations.english: an animal or toy, or a person dressed as an animal, that represents a team or organization, and is thought to bring them good luck

name: research
trans: n. 研究；调查 vi. 研究；调查 vt. 研究；调查 [ 过去式 researched 过去分词 researched 现在分词 researching ]

sentences.english: It’s a good idea to do some research before you buy a house.
sentences.chinese: 买房子之前作些了解，这想法很对。

sentences.english: Gould was helped in his researches by local naturalists.
sentences.chinese: 古尔德在研究过程中得到了当地博物学家的帮助。

sentences.english: He’s been researching material for a documentary.
sentences.chinese: 他一直在研究材料，准备做一个纪录片。

detailed_translations.english: the activity of finding information about something that you are interested in or need to know about
to study a subject in detail, especially in order to discover new facts or test new ideas

name: veterinarian
trans: n. [兽医] 兽医

sentences.english: Include your ferret's medical records and veterinarian information in the package.
sentences.chinese: 救济包里面记得包含貂儿的医疗记录和兽医的信息。

sentences.english: This is not normally an issue that needs professional treatment by a veterinarian.
sentences.chinese: 小小的崩坏通常不需要兽医来为貂儿提供专业的诊疗。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is trained to give medical care and treatment to sick animals

name: ashamed
trans: adj. 羞愧的，羞耻的；惭愧的，内疚的；尴尬的；因怕难堪而不愿意的；觉得丢脸的

sentences.english: Everyone cries sometimes – it’s nothing to be ashamed of.
sentences.chinese: 每个人都会有哭的时候——没什么好难为情的。

detailed_translations.english: feeling very sorry and embarrassed because of something you have done

name: inspire
trans: vt. 激发；鼓舞；启示；产生；使生灵感

sentences.english: We need someone who can inspire the team.
sentences.chinese: 我们需要一个能鼓舞团队士气的人。

sentences.english: Inspired by the sunny weather, I decided to explore the woods.
sentences.chinese: 阳光明媚的天气令人振奋，我决定到森林里寻幽探胜。

sentences.english: The story was inspired by a chance meeting with an old Russian duke.
sentences.chinese: 这个故事的创作灵感来自与一位俄国老公爵的不期而遇。

detailed_translations.english: to encourage someone by making them feel confident and eager to do something

name: move
trans: v. 移动；改变；进展；采取行动；搬家；调动；离开；感动；激起；促使；提议；走棋；快点；出售；使（肠）排空 n. 行动，举措；移动；改变；迁居；步骤；走棋

sentences.english: Please keep the doors closed while the train is moving.
sentences.chinese: 火车行驶时请保持车门关闭。

sentences.english: ‘Come on,’ Sue said. No one moved.
sentences.chinese: “来吧。”休说。但没有人动。

sentences.english: Could you move your car, please? It’s blocking the road.
sentences.chinese: 你能把车挪一下吗？挡着路了。

sentences.english: Becca moved down the steps and into the yard.
sentences.chinese: 贝卡走下台阶，来到院子里。

sentences.english: The bar was so crowded you could hardly move .
sentences.chinese: 酒吧很挤，人都难以挪动。

sentences.english: His speech moved the audience to tears.
sentences.chinese: 他的演讲让听众感动得落泪。

sentences.english: He made no move to come any nearer.
sentences.chinese: 他没有再靠近。

detailed_translations.english: to change from one place or position to another, or to make something do this
when someone moves for a short time in a particular direction

name: outsider
trans: n. 外人；无取胜希望者

sentences.english: I’m an outsider, the only foreign woman in the group.
sentences.chinese: 我是个外人，是这群人里唯一的外国女人。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is not accepted as a member of a particular social group

name: race
trans: n. 属，种；种族，人种；家庭，门第；赛事，赛跑 vt. 使参加比赛；和…竞赛；使急走，使全速行进 vi. 比速度，参加竞赛；全速行进 n. (Race)人名；(英)雷斯；(塞)拉采

sentences.english: The race is on to develop more environmentally friendly forms of energy.
sentences.chinese: 人们正在竞相开发更环保的能源形式。

detailed_translations.english: a situation in which one group of people tries to obtain or achieve something before another group does

name: echolocation
trans: n. 回波定位；回声测距；回声定位能力（鲸和蝙蝠等所具备得一种机能）

sentences.english: Most bats navigate by echolocation.
sentences.chinese: 大多数蝙蝠通过回声定位飞行。

detailed_translations.chinese: 回波定位；回声测距；回声定位能力（鲸和蝙蝠等所具备得一种机能）
detailed_translations.english: Echolocation is a system used by some animals to determine the position of an object by measuring how long it takes for an echo to return from the object

name: hibernate
trans: vi. 过冬；（动物）冬眠；（人等）避寒

sentences.english: Dormice hibernate from October to May.
sentences.chinese: 睡鼠从10月到5月冬眠。

detailed_translations.chinese: 过冬；（动物）冬眠；（人等）避寒
detailed_translations.english: if an animal hibernates, it sleeps for the whole winter

name: migrate
trans: vi. 移动；随季节而移居；移往 vt. 使移居；使移植

sentences.english: People migrate to cities like Jakarta in search of work.
sentences.chinese: 人们移居到雅加达这样的城市找工作。

sentences.english: Most birds have to fly long distances to migrate.
sentences.chinese: 大多数的鸟类不得不飞行很长的距离进行迁徙。

detailed_translations.english: if people migrate, they go to live in another area or country, especially in order to find work

name: anther
trans: n. [植] 花药；花粉囊

name: bellows
trans: n. 波纹管；风箱；皮老虎 n. (Bellows)人名；(英、西)贝洛斯

sentences.english: Music bellows from his insides.
sentences.chinese: 来自他的肚子的音乐风箱。

sentences.english: Yawning helps keep the brain cool, and the sinuses play a role in that process by acting as bellows, a new report suggests.
sentences.chinese: 一份新的报道显示，哈欠能够帮助大脑保持凉爽，鼻窦在这个过程中所起的作用就像是风箱。

sentences.english: Or every bellows burst, be happy Still.
sentences.chinese: 每一只风箱爆炸，她也能开颜。

detailed_translations.english: A bellows is or bellows are a device used for blowing air into a fire in order to make it burn more fiercely

name: congregate
trans: vt. 聚集 vi. 聚集 adj. 集合在一起的

sentences.english: Crowds began to congregate to hear the President’s speech.
sentences.chinese: 人群开始聚拢，来聆听总统的演讲。

detailed_translations.english: to come together in a group

name: extract
trans: v. 提取，提炼；索取，设法得到；选取，摘录；取出，拔出；推断出，引申出；开（方），求（根） n. 摘录，引文；榨出物，汁

sentences.english: You’ll have to have that tooth extracted.
sentences.chinese: 你得把那颗牙拔掉。

sentences.english: Oils are extracted from the plants.
sentences.chinese: 从这些植物中提炼出油。

sentences.english: I’ve only seen short extracts from the film.
sentences.chinese: 我只是看过那部电影的一些小片段。

detailed_translations.english: to remove an object from somewhere, especially with difficulty
a short piece of writing, music etc taken from a particular book, piece of music etc

name: honeycomb
trans: n. 蜂巢；蜂窝状结构，蜂巢式排列物；牛（或羊）肚（反刍动物第二胃做成的食物） v. （使）成蜂窝状；腐蚀，侵蚀 adj. 像蜂巢的

sentences.english: Graphene is a flat sheet of carbon just one atom thick – with the carbon atoms arranged in a honeycomb lattice.
sentences.chinese: 石墨烯是一种只有单原子厚度的碳原子平面层——碳原子按蜂窝状晶格排列。

sentences.english: We demonstrate that the QSH phase present in the honeycomb lattice loses its robustness as the occupancy of extra lattice sites is allowed.
sentences.chinese: 我们证明在蜂窝格点下, 量子自旋霍尔相在额外格点的占据被允许的情况下将失去它的健壮性.

sentences.english: On the other hand, Thompson’s explanation of surface tension ignores the bees, which painstakingly build the honeycomb, and possess capabilities that are not yet fully understood.
sentences.chinese: 而另一方面，汤姆逊的表面张力论忽视了蜜蜂费力建造蜂巢的过程，而且蜜蜂拥有至今仍未弄清的许多能力。

detailed_translations.english: a structure made by  bees  , which consists of many six-sided cells in which honey is stored

detailed_translations.chinese: 使成蜂巢状；把…弄得千疮百孔

name: pistil
trans: n. [植] 雌蕊

name: cargo
trans: n. 货物，船货 n. (Cargo)人名；(英、西)卡戈

sentences.english: a cargo plane
sentences.chinese: 货机

detailed_translations.english: the goods that are being carried in a ship or plane

name: enormous
trans: adj. 庞大的，巨大的；凶暴的，极恶的

sentences.english: an enormous bunch of flowers
sentences.chinese: 巨大的花束

sentences.english: an enormous amount of money
sentences.chinese: 巨款

sentences.english: The team made an enormous effort.
sentences.chinese: 该队付出了巨大的努力。

detailed_translations.english: very big in size or in amount

name: mine
trans: n. 矿，矿藏；矿山，矿井；地雷，水雷 vt. 开采，采掘；在…布雷 vi. 开矿，采矿；埋设地雷 pron. 我的 n. (Mine)人名；(德、塞、土、毛里塔)米内

sentences.english: It was Glen’s idea, not mine.
sentences.chinese: 这是格伦的主意，不是我的。

sentences.english: ‘Is that your car?’ ‘No, mine is parked over the road.’
sentences.chinese: “那是你的车吗？”“不是，我的车停在路对面。”

sentences.english: You’ve got good legs – mine are too thin.
sentences.chinese: 你的腿很美——我的腿太细了。

sentences.english: His English is better than mine.
sentences.chinese: 他英语比我好。

detailed_translations.english: used by the person speaking or writing to refer to something that belongs to or is connected with himself or herself

name: platform
trans: n. 平台；月台，站台；坛；讲台

sentences.english: The Edinburgh train will depart from platform six.
sentences.chinese: 开往爱丁堡的火车将从六号站台发车。

sentences.english: a small raised platform at one end of the room
sentences.chinese: 房间一端凸起的小讲台

sentences.english: an oil exploration platform
sentences.chinese: 石油勘探平台

detailed_translations.english: the raised place beside a railway track where you get on and off a train in a station

name: tunnel
trans: n. 隧道；坑道；洞穴通道 vt. 挖；在…打开通道；在…挖掘隧道 vi. 挖掘隧道；打开通道

sentences.english: a railway tunnel
sentences.chinese: 铁路隧道

sentences.english: the Channel Tunnel (= between England and France )
sentences.chinese: 〔英吉利〕海峡隧道

detailed_translations.english: a passage that has been dug under the ground for cars, trains etc to go through

detailed_translations.chinese: 挖；在…打开通道；在…挖掘隧道
detailed_translations.english: to dig a long passage under the ground

name: vehicle
trans: n. [车辆] 车辆；工具；交通工具；运载工具；传播媒介；媒介物

sentences.english: a description of the stolen vehicle
sentences.chinese: 对被盗车辆的描述

sentences.english: Have you locked your vehicle?
sentences.chinese: 你锁车了吗？

detailed_translations.english: a machine with an engine that is used to take people or things from one place to another, such as a car, bus, or truck

name: biting
trans: adj. 刺痛的；辛辣的 v. 咬；抓住；刺进；欺骗（bite的ing形式）

name: blizzard
trans: n. 暴风雪，大风雪；大打击 vi. 下暴风雪 n. (Blizzard)人名；(英)布利泽德

sentences.english: We got stuck in a blizzard.
sentences.chinese: 我们被暴风雪困住了。

detailed_translations.english: a severe snowstorm

name: frostbite
trans: n. 冻伤，冻疮 v. 冻伤，遭受霜冻 adj. 冬季帆船比赛的

sentences.english: I nearly got frostbite .
sentences.chinese: 我险些冻伤。

detailed_translations.english: a condition caused by extreme cold, that makes your fingers and toes swell, become darker, and sometimes fall off

name: whiteout
trans: n. 临时性失明（因暴露于恶劣环境而引起的）；乳白天空（极地的一种大气光象）

name: chore
trans: n. 家庭杂务；日常的零星事务；讨厌的或累人的工作

sentences.english: everyday chores like shopping and housework
sentences.chinese: 购物和做家务之类的日常琐事

sentences.english: We share the domestic chores.
sentences.chinese: 我们分担家务。

detailed_translations.chinese: 家庭杂务；日常的零星事务；讨厌的或累人的工作
detailed_translations.english: a small job that you have to do regularly, especially work that you do to keep a house clean

name: object
trans: n. 目标；物体；客体；宾语 vt. 提出…作为反对的理由 vi. 反对；拒绝

sentences.english: If no one objects, I would like Mrs Harrison to be present.
sentences.chinese: 如果没人反对的话，我想请哈里森夫人出席。

detailed_translations.english: to feel or say that you oppose or disapprove of something

detailed_translations.chinese: 实物， 物体； 目的， 目标； 对象， 客体； 宾语
detailed_translations.english: a solid thing that you can hold, touch, or see but that is not alive

name: pitch

sentences.english: An accident at the power station could result in large amounts of radiation being released.
sentences.chinese: 发电站事故会造成大量核辐射泄漏。

sentences.english: a lethal dose of radiation
sentences.chinese: 致命剂量的辐射

sentences.english: Sun creams work by blocking harmful ultraviolet radiation.
sentences.chinese: 防晒霜可隔离有害的紫外线辐射。

detailed_translations.english: a form of energy that comes especially from nuclear reactions, which in large amounts is very harmful to living things

name: resource
trans: n. 资源，财力；办法；智谋 vi. 向...提供资金

sentences.english: Canada’s vast mineral resources
sentences.chinese: 加拿大丰富的矿产资源

sentences.english: a country rich in natural resources
sentences.chinese: 自然资源丰富的国家

detailed_translations.chinese: 资源； 财力； 应付办法， 谋略
detailed_translations.english: something such as useful land, or minerals such as oil or coal, that exists in a country and can be used to increase its wealth

name: compete
trans: vi. 竞争；比赛；对抗

sentences.english: The banks have long competed with American Express's charge cards and various shop cards.
sentences.chinese: 这些银行长期以来一直与美国运通公司的记账卡和各种商店卡竞争。

detailed_translations.chinese: 比赛， 竞争， 对抗
detailed_translations.english: if one company or country competes with another, it tries to get people to buy its goods or servicesrather than those available from another company or country

name: hobby
trans: n. 嗜好；业余爱好 n. (Hobby)人名；(英)霍比

sentences.english: What are your hobbies?
sentences.chinese: 你有些什么爱好？

sentences.english: Susan’s hobbies include reading, cooking, and drama.
sentences.chinese: 苏珊的业余爱好包括阅读、烹饪和戏剧。

sentences.english: Retirement gave him the time to pursue his hobbies.
sentences.chinese: 退休以后他有充裕的时间来做自己喜欢做的事。

detailed_translations.english: an activity that you enjoy doing in your free time

name: nutrient
trans: n. 营养物；滋养物 adj. 营养的；滋养的

sentences.english: The plant absorbs nutrients from the soil.
sentences.chinese: 植物从土壤中吸取养分。

detailed_translations.english: a chemical or food that provides what is needed for plants or animals to live and grow

name: pumpkin
trans: n. 南瓜

sentences.english: pumpkin pie
sentences.chinese: 南瓜饼

detailed_translations.english: a very large orange fruit that grows on the ground, or the inside of this fruit

name: record
trans: n. 记录，记载；唱片；（过去的）经历，履历；纪录，最佳成绩；前科，犯罪记录 v. 记录，记载；录制；发表正式声明；（仪器）标明，显示；取得（成就） adj. 创纪录的 n. (Record) （美）勒科尔（人名）

sentences.english: According to official records, five people were killed last year near that road junction.
sentences.chinese: 据官方记录，去年有五人在那个路口附近丧生。

sentences.english: His record reveals a tough streak.
sentences.chinese: 他的经历说明他个性坚强。

sentences.english: Her husband made her record every penny she spent.
sentences.chinese: 她丈夫要她把花的每分钱都记下来。

detailed_translations.english: information about something that is written down or stored on computer, film etc so that it can be looked at in the future
to write information down or store it in a computer or on film so that it can be looked at in the future

name: weigh
trans: vt. 权衡；考虑；称…重量 vi. 重量为…；具有重要性；成为…的重荷；起锚 n. 权衡；称重量

sentences.english: The young birds weigh only a few grams.
sentences.chinese: 雏鸟重量只有几克。

sentences.english: Do you know how much it weighs?
sentences.chinese: 你知道它的重量吗？

sentences.english: (= how much ) do you weigh?
sentences.chinese: 你的体重是多少？

sentences.english: The box was full of books and weighed a ton (= was very heavy ).
sentences.chinese: 这箱子里放满了书，重得很。

detailed_translations.english: to have a particular weight

name: acre
trans: n. 土地，地产；英亩

sentences.english: They own 200 acres of farmland.
sentences.chinese: 他们拥有200英亩农田。

sentences.english: a 200-acre wood
sentences.chinese: 一片200英亩的林地

detailed_translations.english: a unit for measuring area, equal to 4,840 square yards or 4,047 square metres

name: boomer
trans: n. 生育高峰中出生的人；赶往新兴地区安家的人；发育完全的雄袋鼠；异常大的东西；巨浪；大雄袋鼠 n. (Boomer) （美、加、俄、泰）布默（人名）

name: claim
trans: v. 宣称；要求，索取；引起（注意）；获得；夺去（生命）；索赔（钱财）；需要 n. 声称；（财产等）所有权；（向公司等）索赔；专利新特征申明；要求（权利）；（取得的）采矿地；索要

sentences.english: I don’t claim to be a feminist, but I’d like to see more women in top jobs.
sentences.chinese: 我不会自称是女权主义者，但我希望看到更多的女性担任高职。

sentences.english: Opposition leaders will claim victory if the turnout is lower than 50%.
sentences.chinese: 如果投票率低于 50%，反对党领袖将宣布获胜。

detailed_translations.chinese: 声称，主张；对…提出要求，索取；使失踪或死亡；需要，值得
detailed_translations.english: to state that something is true, even though it has not been proved

detailed_translations.chinese: 要求； 认领； 索赔； 声称， 断言
detailed_translations.english: a statement that something is true, even though it has not been proved

name: sooner
trans: adv. 更快地，更早地 n. 抢先占有土地者（在政府开放西部前）

name: stake
trans: n. 桩，棍子；赌注；火刑；奖金 vt. 资助，支持；系…于桩上；把…押下打赌 vi. 打赌 n. (Stake)人名；(瑞典)斯塔克

sentences.english: They have to win the contract – thousands of jobs are at stake.
sentences.chinese: 他们必须拿下这份合同，这关系到数千个工作岗位。

sentences.english: National pride is at stake in next week’s game against England.
sentences.chinese: 下星期对英格兰队的比赛关乎民族尊严。

detailed_translations.english: if something that you value very much is at stake, you will lose it if a plan or action is not successful

name: territory
trans: n. 领土，领域；范围；地域；版图

sentences.english: Hong Kong is a Chinese territory.
sentences.chinese: 香港是中国的领土。

sentences.english: The company is moving into unfamiliar territory with this new software.
sentences.chinese: 该公司正通过这种新软件进入一个不熟悉的领域。

detailed_translations.english: land that is owned or controlled by a particular country, ruler, or military force

name: echo
trans: vt. 反射；重复 vi. 随声附和；发出回声 n. 回音；效仿

sentences.english: Her scream was followed by a loud echo.
sentences.chinese: 她的尖叫声过后是响亮的回声。

sentences.english: ‘He's gone! ’ Viv echoed.
sentences.chinese: “他去了！”维夫重复道。

detailed_translations.english: a sound that you hear again after a loud noise, because it was made near something such as a wall
to repeat what someone else has just said

name: pinch
trans: v. 捏；夹紧；夹（脚）；（由于担心或紧张）抿（嘴唇）；（非正式）行窃；使入不敷出；（为促进生长）摘除（芽、叶等）；节约 n. 捏，拧；少量（非正式）偷窃 n. (Pinch) （美、加、英）平奇（人名）

sentences.english: We have to stop her pinching her baby brother.
sentences.chinese: 我们不能让她再掐她小弟弟了。

sentences.english: He pinched her cheek.
sentences.chinese: 他捏了一下她的脸颊。

sentences.english: Put all the ingredients, including a pinch of salt, into a food processor.
sentences.chinese: 将所有的配料，连同一撮盐，放进食品加工机里。

detailed_translations.english: to press a part of someone’s skin very tightly between your finger and thumb, especially so that it hurts
A pinch of an ingredient such as salt is the amount of it that you can hold between your thumb and your first finger

name: shudder
trans: n. 发抖；战栗；震动 vi. 发抖；战栗

sentences.english: As we stood there staring at each other, a shudder passed through me.
sentences.chinese: 我们站在那里对望着彼此，突如其来地，我感到一阵战栗。

sentences.english: " Montaigne gives a similar example, saying that if you put a sage on the edge of a precipice, "he must shudder like a child.
sentences.chinese: 蒙田举了个类似的例子，说如果你把一个圣人放在悬崖边上，“他一定像个孩子一样发抖”。

name: stepmother
trans: n. 继母，后母

sentences.english: She looked at me as if I were the wicked stepmother.
sentences.chinese: 她看我的眼神，我简直就是一个恶毒的后母。

detailed_translations.english: a woman who is married to your father but who is not your mother

name: treasure
trans: n. 财富，财产；财宝；珍品 vt. 珍爱；珍藏 n. (Treasure)（英、美、爱）特雷热（人名）

sentences.english: buried treasure
sentences.chinese: 埋藏的财宝

sentences.english: the priceless art treasures of the Uffizi gallery.
sentences.chinese: 乌菲齐美术馆收藏的无价艺术瑰宝

sentences.english: I treasure his friendship.
sentences.chinese: 我珍重他的友谊。

detailed_translations.english: a collection of valuable things such as gold, silver and jewellery
to keep and care for something that is very special, important, or valuable to you

name: wicked
trans: adj. 邪恶的；恶劣的；不道德的；顽皮的

sentences.english: the wicked stepmother in ‘Hansel and Gretel’
sentences.chinese: 《糖果屋》中那个恶毒的继母

detailed_translations.english: behaving in a way that is morally wrong

name: conditions
trans: n. （生活或工作等的）条件；（影响某事发生的）物质环境；（天气、地面等的）情况 n. 疾病；条款；先决条件（condition 的复数） v. 制约；（使）接受；（使）达到所要求的状态；（使）酿熟；（啤酒等）继续发酵；保养（皮肤、头发）；（使）健康；提出条件；给学生打需补考的分数（condition 的第三人称单数形式）

sentences.chinese: …过去18年来干旱和饥荒致死达两百万人的一个国家。

detailed_translations.english: a long period of dry weather when there is not enough water for plants and animals to live

name: famine
trans: n. 饥荒；饥饿，奇缺

sentences.english: the great potato famine in Ireland
sentences.chinese: 爱尔兰严重的土豆荒

sentences.english: A million people are facing famine .
sentences.chinese: 一百万人正面临饥荒。

name: instrument
trans: n. 仪器；工具；乐器；手段；器械 v. 给……装测量仪器

sentences.english: surgical instruments
sentences.chinese: 外科(手术)器械

detailed_translations.english: a small tool used in work such as science or medicine

name: locust
trans: n. [植保] 蝗虫，[昆] 蚱蜢

sentences.english: a swarm of locusts
sentences.chinese: 一大群蝗虫

detailed_translations.english: an insect that lives mainly in Asia and Africa and flies in a very large group, eating and destroying crops

trans: n. 一大群；蜂群；人群；一大群小型天体同时在空中出现 v. 成群来回移动；蜂拥而至；挤满；爬；（蜜蜂）成群飞离蜂巢

sentences.chinese: 几分钟之内这个地方挤满了警官，他们开始搜查附近的一片树林。

name: explosive
trans: adj. 爆炸的；爆炸性的；爆发性的 n. 炸药；爆炸物

sentences.chinese: …150磅的塞姆汀塑料炸药。

sentences.english: Because the gas is highly explosive, it needs to be kept in high-pressure containers.
sentences.chinese: 由于这种气体极易爆炸，因此需要保存在高压容器内。

name: handler
trans: n. 处理者；管理者；拳击教练；（犬马等的）训练者 n. (Handler)人名；(法)昂德莱；(英)汉德勒

sentences.chinese: 这真的是怪兽，有点像啮齿动物，但长着恐龙一样的嘴巴。

sentences.chinese: 但是，这项新的研究发现，70%的啮齿动物和灵长目动物的物种具有阑尾。

sentences.chinese: 像疟原虫在蚊子和人之间循环一样，弓形虫的循环界于其啮齿类和猫科宿主之间，在不同宿主体内活出不同的生存阶段。

sentences.chinese: 玛格丽特可怜地抽泣着点了点头。

trans: n. 火车；行列；长队；裙裾 v. 培养；训练；瞄准 n. (Train)人名；(英)特雷恩；(法)特兰；(意)特拉因

sentences.chinese: 我们一路坐火车到因弗内斯。

detailed_translations.english: a set of several carriages that are connected to each other and pulled along a railway line by an engine

name: Congress
trans: n. 国会；代表大会；会议；社交

name: lawyer
trans: n. 律师；法学家 n. (Lawyer)人名；(英)劳耶

sentences.english: Prosecution and defence lawyers are expected to deliver closing arguments next week.
sentences.chinese: 原告律师和被告律师下周将要作终结辩论。

detailed_translations.english: someone whose job is to advise people about laws, write formal agreements, or represent people in court

name: nominee
trans: n. 被任命者；被提名的人；代名人

sentences.english: the Democratic Party presidential nominee
sentences.chinese: 民主党被提名的总统候选人

detailed_translations.chinese: 被任命者；被提名的人；代名人
detailed_translations.english: someone who has been officially suggested for an important position, duty, or prize

name: senator
trans: n. 参议员；（古罗马的）元老院议员；评议员，理事 n. (Senator)人名；(瑞典、斯威)塞纳托尔

sentences.english: Senator Kennedy
sentences.chinese: 肯尼迪参议员

detailed_translations.english: a member of the Senate or a senate

name: impressive
trans: adj. 感人的；令人钦佩的；给人以深刻印象的

sentences.english: The figures certainly look impressive.
sentences.chinese: 这些数字看上去确实很可观。

sentences.english: Among the guests was an impressive array of authors and critics.
sentences.chinese: 来宾中有不少出色的作家和评论家。

detailed_translations.english: something that is impressive makes you admire it because it is very good, large, important etc

name: rancid
trans: adj. 腐臭的；令人作呕的，讨厌的

sentences.english: rancid butter
sentences.chinese: 变质黄油

detailed_translations.chinese: 腐臭的；令人作呕的，讨厌的
detailed_translations.english: oily or fatty food that is rancid smells or tastes unpleasant because it is no longer fresh

name: Reuben
trans: n. 流便（圣经人物）；鲁宾（男子名）

name: tasty
trans: adj. 美味的；高雅的；有趣的 n. 可口的东西；引人入胜的东西

sentences.english: a simple but tasty meal
sentences.chinese: 简单而可口的饭菜

detailed_translations.english: food that is tasty has a good taste, but is not sweet

detailed_translations.chinese: 可口的东西；引人入胜的东西

name: bazaar
trans: n. 集市；市场；义卖市场

sentences.english: Kamal was a vendor in Cairo's open-air bazaar.
sentences.chinese: 卡莫尔曾是开罗露天集市的摊贩。

detailed_translations.english: a market or area where there are a lot of small shops, especially in India or the Middle East

name: church
trans: n. 教堂；礼拜；教派 adj. 教会的；礼拜的 vt. 领…到教堂接受宗教仪式 n. (Church)人名；(英)丘奇

sentences.english: a short church service
sentences.chinese: 简短的教堂礼拜仪式

sentences.english: church bells
sentences.chinese: 教堂的钟

detailed_translations.english: a building where Christians go to worship

detailed_translations.chinese: 领…到教堂接受宗教仪式

name: cistern
trans: n. 水箱；水池；贮水器

name: landmark
trans: n. [航]陆标；地标；界标；里程碑；纪念碑；地界标；划时代的事 adj. 有重大意义或影响的 n. （瑞典、挪）兰德马克（人名）

name: mosque
trans: n. 清真寺

sentences.chinese: 你会去教堂，犹太教会，或者清真寺吗？

sentences.english: If there is to be a new city church, they argue, then why not a mosque?
sentences.chinese: 他们置疑说，如果要修建一个新的城市教堂为什么不能是座清真寺呢？

sentences.chinese: 告诉教堂或清真寺的会众们，存在，是强加在他们的上帝身上的一种过于庸俗的属性，他们将会指责你为无神论者。

name: tower
trans: n. 塔；高楼；堡垒 vi. 高耸；超越 n. (Tower)人名；(英)托尔

sentences.english: the Eiffel Tower
sentences.chinese: 埃菲尔铁塔

sentences.english: a castle with tall towers
sentences.chinese: 有高高的塔楼的城堡

sentences.english: He towered over his mother.
sentences.chinese: 他比他的母亲高出很多。

detailed_translations.english: a tall narrow building either built on its own or forming part of a castle, church etc

name: Africa
trans: n. 非洲

sentences.chinese: 长颈鹿生长在非洲。

sentences.english: The practice still prevails in some parts of Africa.
sentences.chinese: 这种做法在非洲某些地区仍然很盛行。

sentences.english: He traversed alone the whole continent of Africa from east to west.
sentences.chinese: 他只身长途跋涉， 从东向西横穿整个非洲大陆。

name: behavior
