detailed_translations.chinese: 行为， 举止， 表现

name: chimpanzee
trans: n. [脊椎] 黑猩猩

sentences.english: So when you go from head to toe, you're seeing a mosaic creature that is neither chimpanzee, nor is it human.
sentences.chinese: 所以从头到脚，让人看到的是一个在黑猩猩和人类之间模棱两可的生物，这就是始祖地人猿。

sentences.english: By hunting or gathering away from the group, both chimpanzee and dolphin moms ensure that what they find goes to their young.
sentences.chinese: 黑猩猩和海豚妈妈们远离群体打猎和收集食物，并保证他们所找到的食物都给孩子们。

sentences.english: It was, if I can give a chimpanzee language, I can empty the contents of his mind. He can tell me what he's thinking, how he sees the world.
sentences.chinese: 他的想法是，如果我能交给黑猩猩一种语言的话，我就可以掏空他的想法，他可以告诉我他在想什么，他是怎样看这个世界的。

detailed_translations.english: an intelligent African animal that is like a large monkey without a tail

name: balancing
trans: n. 平衡；结算；调零装置

name: inversion
trans: n. 倒置；反向；倒转

sentences.english: ...a scandalous inversion of the truth.
sentences.chinese: ...一个令人愤慨的是非颠倒。

detailed_translations.english: the act of changing something so that it is the opposite of what it was before, or of turning something upside down (= the bottom is on the top and the top is on the bottom )

name: meditation
trans: n. 冥想；沉思，深思；静坐

sentences.english: Yoga involves breathing exercises, stretching, and meditation.
sentences.chinese: 瑜伽包括呼吸训练、伸展和冥想。

sentences.english: She found him sitting alone, deep in meditation.
sentences.chinese: 她发现他独自坐着，陷入沉思。

detailed_translations.chinese: 默想，冥想；沉思，深思，思考
detailed_translations.english: the practice of emptying your mind of thoughts and feelings, in order to relax completely or for religious reasons

name: pose
trans: vt. 造成，形成；摆姿势；装模作样；提出…讨论 vi. 摆姿势；佯装；矫揉造作 n. 姿势，姿态；装模作样

sentences.english: We posed for photographs.
sentences.chinese: 我们摆好姿势准备拍照。

sentences.english: Ann struck a pose (= stood or sat in a particular position ) and smiled for the camera.
sentences.chinese: 安摆好姿势露出笑脸准备拍照。

detailed_translations.english: to sit or stand in a particular position in order to be photographed or painted, or to make someone do this
the position in which someone stands or sits, especially in a painting, photograph etc

name: salutation
trans: n. 称呼；问候；招呼；寒喧

sentences.english: Jackson nodded a salutation.
sentences.chinese: 杰克逊点头打了个招呼。

detailed_translations.english: a word or phrase used at the beginning of a letter or speech, such as ‘Dear Mr Smith’

name: yoga
trans: n. （印度）瑜伽，瑜伽术，瑜伽派

sentences.english: I do yoga twice a week.
sentences.chinese: 我一周做两次瑜伽。

detailed_translations.chinese: 瑜珈（意为“结合”，指修行）；瑜珈术
detailed_translations.english: a system of exercises that help you control your mind and body in order to relax

name: defend
trans: vt. 辩护；防护 vi. 保卫；防守

sentences.english: She was always defending her husband in front of their daughter.
sentences.chinese: 她在女儿面前总是为丈夫辩解。

sentences.english: Students should be ready to explain and defend their views.
sentences.chinese: 学生应该勇于为自己的观点进行解释和辩护。

detailed_translations.english: to use arguments to protect something or someone from criticism, or to prove that something is right

name: discipline
trans: n. 学科；纪律；训练；惩罚 vt. 训练，训导；惩戒

sentences.english: Martial arts teach respect, discipline, and cooperation.
sentences.chinese: 武术能教人尊重他人、遵守纪律并且相互合作。

sentences.english: Learning poetry is a good discipline for the memory.
sentences.chinese: 背诗是训练记忆力的一种好方法。

sentences.english: Different cultures have different ways of disciplining their children.
sentences.chinese: 不同的文化有不同的管教孩子的方法。

detailed_translations.english: a way of training someone so that they learn to control their behaviour and obey rules
to teach someone to obey rules and control their behaviour

name: dojo
trans: n. 武术馆，道场；柔道训练学校 n. (Dojo) （美、日）道焦（人名）

name: karate
trans: n. 空手道（日本的一种徒手武术）

sentences.english: No, I had it when I walked out the door. Dad picked me up to drive me to karate.
sentences.chinese: 不可能，我出门的时候还带着，爸爸开车接我去上空手道的课，然后我把书包放在车里。

sentences.english: Generally you exhale on the effort, if, say, doing weights, karate or boxing, and inhale on the “return”.
sentences.chinese: 一般来说，如果你在练哑铃、空手道或拳击，你呼出的是努力，吸入的是“回报”。

detailed_translations.chinese: 空手道（日本的一种徒手武术）
detailed_translations.english: a Japanese fighting sport, in which you use your feet and hands to hit and kick

name: debris
trans: n. 碎片，残骸 n. (Debris)人名；(法)德布里

sentences.english: She was hit by flying debris from the blast.
sentences.chinese: 她被爆炸产生的飞散碎片击中。

detailed_translations.english: the pieces of something that are left after it has been destroyed in an accident, explosion etc

name: depart
trans: vi. 离开；出发，起程；违反；去世 adj. 逝世的

sentences.english: Flights by Air Europe depart Gatwick on Tuesdays.
sentences.chinese: 欧洲航空公司的航班每逢周二从盖特威克机场起飞。

detailed_translations.chinese: 离开；出发，起程；违反；去世
detailed_translations.english: to leave, especially when you are starting a journey

name: dependent
trans: adj. 依靠的；从属的；取决于…的 n. 依赖他人者；受赡养者

sentences.english: Jan’s mother was dependent on her for physical care.
sentences.chinese: 简的母亲要靠简来照顾。

sentences.english: Do you have any dependent children (= who you are still supporting financially ) ?
sentences.chinese: 你有没有需要扶养的孩子？

detailed_translations.english: needing someone or something in order to exist, be successful, be healthy etc

name: observe
trans: vt. 庆祝 vt. 观察；遵守；说；注意到；评论 vi. 观察；说；注意到；评论

sentences.english: Scientists have observed a drop in ozone levels over the Antarctic.
sentences.chinese: 科学家已经观察到南极洲上方的臭氧浓度有所下降。

sentences.english: Predators have been observed to avoid attacking brightly coloured species.
sentences.chinese: 据观察发现，食肉动物会避免袭击色彩鲜艳的物种。

sentences.english: The army was observing a ceasefire.
sentences.chinese: 军队当时在遵守一项停火协议。

sentences.english: ‘Sid looks ill,’ Doherty observed.
sentences.chinese: “锡德看上去病了。”多尔蒂说道。

detailed_translations.english: to see and notice something

name: souvenir
trans: n. 纪念品；礼物 vt. 把…留作纪念

sentences.english: a souvenir shop
sentences.chinese: 纪念品商店

detailed_translations.english: an object that you buy or keep to remind yourself of a special occasion or a place you have visited

name: disappointment
trans: n. 失望；沮丧

sentences.english: He could see the disappointment in her eyes.
sentences.chinese: 他看到了她眼中的失望。

sentences.english: Several people expressed disappointment at the delay.
sentences.chinese: 有好几个人对这次延误表示失望。

sentences.english: She hid her bitter disappointment .
sentences.chinese: 她把深深的沮丧掩饰起来。

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of unhappiness because something is not as good as you expected, or has not happened in the way you hoped

name: enthusiasm
trans: n. 热心，热忱，热情

sentences.english: Gillian and Darren greeted the speakers with great enthusiasm.
sentences.chinese: 吉利恩和达伦非常热情地接待了演讲者。

sentences.english: We went along to the local diving club, full of enthusiasm.
sentences.chinese: 我们兴高采烈地去了当地的潜水俱乐部。

sentences.english: They go about their tasks with little enthusiasm.
sentences.chinese: 他们执行任务时没多大干劲。

sentences.english: A delay of two hours did not dampen their enthusiasm.
sentences.chinese: 耽误了两小时没有减弱他们的热情。

detailed_translations.chinese: 热情， 热心， 热忱； 巨大兴趣
detailed_translations.english: a strong feeling of interest and enjoyment about something and an eagerness to be involved in it

name: kickball
trans: n. 儿童足球游戏

name: sign
trans: n. 迹象；符号；记号；手势；指示牌 vi. 签署；签名 vt. 签署；示意

sentences.english: the dollar sign
sentences.chinese: 美元符号

sentences.english: a minus sign
sentences.chinese: 减号

sentences.english: a sign on the door
sentences.chinese: 门上的标牌

sentences.english: Sign here, please.
sentences.chinese: 请在这里签字。

detailed_translations.english: a mark or shape that has a particular meaning
to write your signature on something to show that you wrote it, agree with it, or were present

name: yearbook
trans: n. 年鉴；年刊

name: campaign
trans: n. 运动；活动；战役，军事行动；竞选 v. 领导或参加运动；参加竞选

sentences.english: Jones ran a good campaign.
sentences.chinese: 琼斯的活动搞得很成功。

sentences.english: Police have launched a campaign to crack down on drug dealers.
sentences.chinese: 警方发起了一场严厉打击毒贩的运动。

detailed_translations.english: a series of actions intended to achieve a particular result relating to politics or business, or a social improvement

name: elect
trans: v. 选举；选择，决定（做某事）；（上帝）挑选（某人）（使其灵魂永远得救） adj. 卓越的；蒙上帝挑选（而得救）的；当选（而尚未就职的） n. 被选的人；上帝的选民；特权集体

sentences.english: the country’s first democratically elected government
sentences.chinese: 该国第一个民主选举产生的政府

sentences.english: You can elect to delete the message or save it.
sentences.chinese: 你可以选择删除或者保存信息。

detailed_translations.english: to choose someone for an official position by voting

name: legislative
trans: adj. 立法的；有立法权的 n. 立法权；立法机构

sentences.english: The new assemblies will have no legislative power.
sentences.chinese: 新的议会将没有立法权。

sentences.english: new legislative measures to stem the flow of drugs into the US
sentences.chinese: 遏制毒品流入美国的新的立法措施

detailed_translations.english: concerned with making laws

name: reject
trans: vt. 拒绝；排斥；抵制；丢弃 n. 被弃之物或人；次品

sentences.english: Sarah rejected her brother’s offer of help.
sentences.chinese: 萨拉拒绝了她弟弟的帮助。

sentences.english: Dexter flatly rejected (= completely rejected ) calls for his resignation.
sentences.chinese: 德克斯特断然拒绝让他辞职的要求。

sentences.english: His proposal was rejected outright (= completely rejected ) .
sentences.chinese: 他的建议被彻底否决了。

detailed_translations.chinese: 拒绝； 拒纳， 退回， 摈弃
detailed_translations.english: to refuse to accept, believe in, or agree with something

detailed_translations.chinese: 被拒货品， 不合格产品
detailed_translations.english: a product that has been rejected because there is something wrong with it

name: Senate
trans: n. 参议院，上院；（古罗马的）元老院

name: clever
trans: adj. 聪明的；机灵的；熟练的 [ 比较级cleverer 最高级 cleverest ]

sentences.english: a clever man
sentences.chinese: 聪明的人

detailed_translations.english: able to learn and understand things quickly

name: language
trans: n. 语言；语言文字；表达能力

sentences.english: How many languages do you speak?
sentences.chinese: 你能说几种语言？

sentences.english: one of the best-known poems in the English language
sentences.chinese: 最著名的英语诗歌之一

detailed_translations.english: a system of communication by written or spoken words, which is used by the people of a particular country or area

name: parallel
trans: n. 平行线；对比 vt. 使…与…平行 adj. 平行的；类似的，相同的

sentences.english: Lines AB and CD are parallel. AB
sentences.chinese: 线与CD线平行。

sentences.english: two parallel roads
sentences.chinese: 两条平行的道路

sentences.english: Take the road running parallel to the main road just after the village.
sentences.chinese: 过那个村子后走与主干道平行的路。

detailed_translations.chinese: 并列的，平行的；类似的；对应的；并联的
detailed_translations.english: two lines, paths etc that are parallel to each other are the same distance apart along their whole length

detailed_translations.chinese: 可相比拟的事物，相似处；平行线，平行面；纬线
detailed_translations.english: a relationship or similarity between two things, especially things that exist or happen in different places or at different times

detailed_translations.chinese: 与…相似， 与… 相当， 比得上
detailed_translations.english: if one thing parallels another, they happen at the same time or are similar, and seem to be related

name: riddle
trans: n. 谜语；神秘事件；（筛分土石的）粗筛 v. 在……上弄许多小洞；充斥，布满；用粗筛筛；摇动（炉栅）使灰落下；出谜；为（某人）解（谜） n. (Riddle)（美、英、加）里德尔（人名）

sentences.english: See if you can solve this riddle .
sentences.chinese: 看看你能不能猜出这个谜语。

detailed_translations.english: to solve, explain, or interpret (a riddle or riddles)

detailed_translations.chinese: 谜语；粗筛；谜一般的人、东西、事情等
detailed_translations.english: a question that is deliberately very confusing and has a humorous or clever answer

name: diagnose
trans: vt. 诊断；断定 vi. 诊断；判断

sentences.english: How did they diagnose you?
sentences.chinese: 他们怎么给你的诊断的？

sentences.english: What tools do you need to help you diagnose the problem, and where do you get them?
sentences.chinese: 您需要什么工具来帮助您诊断问题，可以从哪里获得这些工具？

sentences.english: Evidently this springs from some defect in their nature, but it is one not altogether easy either to diagnose of to cure.
sentences.chinese: 这种情形显然源于他们本性上的某种缺陷，但是这种缺陷既不容易诊断也不容易治疗。

detailed_translations.english: to find out what illness someone has, or what the cause of a fault is, after doing tests, examinations etc

name: hatch
trans: n. 孵化；舱口 vt. 孵；策划 vi. 孵化 n. (Hatch)人名；(西)阿奇；(英)哈奇

sentences.english: The problems do not end if crocodiles successfully hatch from the eggs.
sentences.chinese: 即使鳄鱼成功地从卵中孵化出来，这些问题也不会终止。

detailed_translations.english: a hole in a ship or aircraft, usually used for loading goods, or the door that covers it
if an egg hatches, or if it is hatched, it breaks, letting the young bird, insect etc come out

name: inject
trans: vt. 注入；注射

sentences.english: His son was injected with strong drugs.
sentences.chinese: 他的儿子被注射了强效的药。

detailed_translations.english: to put liquid, especially a drug, into someone’s body by using a special needle

name: lice
trans: n. 虱子（louse 的复数）

name: nit
trans: n. 幼虫；没用的人 n. (Nit)人名；(俄)尼特；(泰)尼

name: treatment
trans: n. 治疗，疗法；处理；对待

sentences.english: There have been great advances in the treatment of cancer.
sentences.chinese: 癌症治疗有了很大的进展。

sentences.english: Just lately, Kyra has been giving me the silent treatment (= refusing to speak to me because she is angry with me ) .
sentences.chinese: 就在最近，凯拉一直对我不理不睬。

detailed_translations.english: something that is done to cure someone who is injured or ill

name: discern
trans: vt. 觉察出；识别；了解；隐约看见 vi. 辨别

sentences.english: You need a long series of data to be able to discern such a trend.
sentences.chinese: 你需要一大串数据才能认清这一趋势。

sentences.english: We could just discern a town in the distance.
sentences.chinese: 我们依稀看到远处有一座城镇。

detailed_translations.english: to notice or understand something by thinking about it carefully

name: dread
trans: v. 惧怕，担心；敬畏 n. 恐惧，可怕的人（或物）；（鸟群的）惊飞，惊起；将头发编成“骇人”发型的人 adj. 可怕的；令人敬畏的

sentences.english: The prospect of flying filled me with dread .
sentences.chinese: 想到要乘飞机我充满了恐惧。

sentences.english: She lives in dread of (= is continuously very afraid of ) the disease returning.
sentences.chinese: 她整天担心着会旧病复发。

detailed_translations.english: a strong fear of something that is going to happen or may happen
to feel anxious or worried about something that is going to happen or may happen

name: hasten
trans: vt. 加速；使赶紧；催促 vi. 赶快；急忙

sentences.english: Their departure was hastened by an abnormally cold winter.
sentences.chinese: 那个冬天异常寒冷，所以他们提前走了。

detailed_translations.english: to make something happen faster or sooner

name: stranger
trans: n. 陌生人；外地人；局外人 n. (Stranger)人名；(瑞典)斯特朗格；(英)斯特兰杰

sentences.english: Children must not talk to strangers.
sentences.chinese: 小孩子千万不要同陌生人说话。

sentences.english: Sorry, I don't know where the bank is. I'm a stranger here myself.
sentences.chinese: 对不起，我不知道银行在哪儿。我不是本地人。

detailed_translations.english: someone that you do not know

name: swallow
trans: vt. 忍受；吞没 vi. 吞下；咽下 n. 燕子；一次吞咽的量 n. (Swallow)人名；(英)斯沃洛

sentences.english: He swallowed the last of his coffee and asked for the bill.
sentences.chinese: 他喝完最后一口咖啡，要求结账。

sentences.english: Most snakes swallow their prey whole .
sentences.chinese: 大多数蛇都是把猎物囫囵吞下。

detailed_translations.english: to make food or drink go down your throat and towards your stomach

name: tickle
trans: vt. 使发痒；使高兴；使满足 vi. 觉得痒；（东西）使人发痒 n. 胳肢；痒感；使人发痒、高兴的东西 n. (Tickle)人名；(英)蒂克尔

sentences.english: Stop tickling me!
sentences.chinese: 别挠我痒痒！

detailed_translations.english: to move your fingers gently over someone’s body in order to make them laugh
if something touching your body tickles you, it makes you want to rub your body because it is slightly uncomfortable
a feeling in your throat that makes you want to cough

name: delicious
trans: adj. 美味的；可口的

sentences.english: ‘The meal was absolutely delicious,’ she said politely.
sentences.chinese: “这顿饭味道好极了。” 她礼貌地说道。

sentences.english: the delicious smell of new-mown grass
sentences.chinese: 新修剪的草坪的芳香

detailed_translations.english: very pleasant to taste or smell

name: furious
trans: adj. 激烈的；狂怒的；热烈兴奋的；喧闹的

sentences.english: She was absolutely furious .
sentences.chinese: 她怒不可遏。

sentences.english: There was a furious row over the proposals.
sentences.chinese: 关于这些提议的争论非常激烈。

detailed_translations.english: very angry

name: host
trans: n. [计] 主机；主人；主持人；许多 vt. 主持；当主人招待 vi. 群集；做主人

sentences.english: Which country is going to host the next World Cup?
sentences.chinese: 哪个国家将主办下一届世界杯？

detailed_translations.english: to provide the place and everything that is needed for an organized event

name: neighbor
trans: n. 邻居 adj. 邻近的 vi. 友好；毗邻而居 vt. 邻接 n. (Neighbor)人名；(英)内伯

sentences.english: I parked my baby at the neighbor's house.
sentences.chinese: 我把小孩寄放在邻居家里。

sentences.english: It means you love Him with all your heart, and you love your neighbor as yourself.
sentences.chinese: 它意味着你全心全意的爱上帝并且像爱自己那样爱邻居。

sentences.english: See, if you break any one of those commandments, you do not love your neighbor as yourself.
sentences.chinese: 看，如果你违反了其中任何一条戒律，你就没能像爱自己那样爱邻居。

name: spiciest
trans: 辛辣的 香的（ spicy的最高级 ）

name: translate
trans: vt. 翻译；转化；解释；转变为；调动 vi. 翻译

sentences.english: Poetry doesn’t usually translate well.
sentences.chinese: 诗歌通常都译不好。

detailed_translations.chinese: 翻译；转化；解释；转变为；调动
detailed_translations.english: to change written or spoken words into another language

name: creature
trans: n. 动物，生物；人；创造物

sentences.english: all the living creatures in the sea
sentences.chinese: 海洋中所有的生物

detailed_translations.english: anything that is living, such as an animal, fish, or insect, but not a plant

name: evidence
trans: n. 证据，证明；迹象；明显 vt. 证明

sentences.english: We found further scientific evidence for this theory.
sentences.chinese: 我们找到了进一步证实这种理论的科学根据。

sentences.english: I was asked to give evidence (= to say what I knew, describe what I had seen, etc.)
sentences.chinese: 我被要求出庭作证。

detailed_translations.english: facts or signs that show clearly that something exists or is true

name: exist
trans: vi. 存在；生存；生活；继续存在

sentences.english: The custom of arranged marriages still exists in many countries.
sentences.chinese: 许多国家仍存在包办婚姻的习俗。

sentences.english: Opportunities exist for students to gain sponsorship.
sentences.chinese: 学生有机会获得资助。

sentences.english: Stop pretending that the problem doesn’t exist.
sentences.chinese: 别再假装这个问题不存在了。

sentences.english: We existed on a diet of rice.
sentences.chinese: 我们靠吃大米过活。

detailed_translations.english: to be present in a place or situation

name: hoax
trans: n. 恶作剧；骗局；谎报 v. 捉弄，欺骗

sentences.english: a bomb hoax
sentences.chinese: 虚假炸弹恐吓

sentences.english: (= telephone calls giving false information ) to the police
sentences.chinese: 恶作剧报警电话

detailed_translations.english: a false warning about something dangerous

name: primate
trans: n. 灵长目动物（包括人、猴子等）；大主教；首领 adj. 灵长目动物的；大主教的

sentences.english: The woolly spider monkey is the largest primate in the Americas.
sentences.chinese: 绒毛蛛猴是美洲最大的灵长目动物。

detailed_translations.chinese: 大主教；灵长类的动物；首领
detailed_translations.english: a member of the group of animals that includes humans and monkeys

name: sighting
trans: n. 瞄准；照准；视线 v. 看见（sight的ing形式）

sentences.english: The perfectly formed peak of Mount Fuji is notoriously shy, so any sighting has to be counted as a blessing.
sentences.chinese: 富士山峰造型完美，但是它的害羞却是声名远播，所以任何能看见它的人都似有神助。

sentences.english: Crop circle researcher Andrew Russell, who is investigating the bizarre sighting on behalf of the officer, described the moment his sighting was made.
sentences.chinese: 麦田怪圈研究人员安德鲁·罗素代表这位警官调查他的离奇发现。 他描述了警官当时看到的情形。

name: examine
trans: vt. 检查；调查； 检测；考试 vi. 检查；调查

sentences.english: A team of divers was sent down to examine the wreck.
sentences.chinese: 一组潜水员被送到水下检查沉船。

sentences.english: Hegel’s philosophy will be examined in detail in Chapter 4.
sentences.chinese: 黑格尔的哲学将在第4章作详细探讨。

detailed_translations.english: to look at something carefully and thoroughly because you want to find out more about it

name: lost
trans: adj. 迷路的，迷失的；失去的，丧失的；无法恢复的；迷惘的，丧失信心的；处于困境的；逝去的；死亡的；失败的 v. 失去；遗失；痛失；流产；牺牲；失败（lose 的过去式和过去分词）

sentences.english: ‘Are you lost?’ the driver asked.
sentences.chinese: “你迷路了吗？”司机问道。

sentences.english: I got thoroughly lost on the way here.
sentences.chinese: 我来这里时完全迷了路。

sentences.english: a lost child
sentences.chinese: 一个走失的孩子

detailed_translations.english: if you are lost, you do not know where you are and are unable to find your way somewhere

name: responsibility
trans: n. 责任，职责；义务

sentences.english: Kelly’s promotion means more money and more responsibility.
sentences.chinese: 凯利获得提升，这意味着钱多了，责任也更大了。

detailed_translations.english: a duty to be in charge of someone or something, so that you make decisions and can be blamed if something bad happens

name: rummage
trans: vt. 检查；搜出；仔细搜查；翻找出 n. 翻找；检查；查出的物件；零星杂物 vi. 翻找；仔细搜查

sentences.english: They rummage through piles of secondhand clothes for something that fits.
sentences.chinese: 他们在成堆的二手衣服中翻找合身的衣服。

detailed_translations.chinese: 检查；搜出；仔细搜查；翻找出
detailed_translations.english: to search for something by moving things around in a careless or hurried way

detailed_translations.chinese: 翻找；检查；查出的物件；零星杂物
detailed_translations.english: a careless or hurried search for something

name: umpire
trans: n. 裁判员，仲裁人 v. 仲裁，裁判；当裁判，任裁判

sentences.english: He umpired baseball games.
sentences.chinese: 他过去担任棒球比赛的裁判。

detailed_translations.english: to be the umpire in a game or competition
the person who makes sure that the players obey the rules in sports such as tennis, baseball, and cricket

name: magnetic
trans: adj. 地磁的；有磁性的；有吸引力的

sentences.english: magnetic forces
sentences.chinese: 磁力

sentences.english: a magnetic personality
sentences.chinese: 富有魅力的个性

detailed_translations.english: concerning or produced by  magnetism

name: migration
trans: n. 迁移；移民；移动

sentences.english: What does this migration not do?
sentences.chinese: 这种迁移不能做什么？

sentences.english: Because of this and other differences in the two versions, we recommend that you test the maps after migration.
sentences.chinese: 由于这两个版本之间的种种差异，我们建议您在完成迁移后对映射进行测试。

detailed_translations.english: when large numbers of people go to live in another area or country, especially in order to find work

name: navigate
trans: v. 导航；航行，驾驶；找到正确的应对方法；（在互联网上）浏览；（艰难地）走过；（尤指穿过人群）带人找路

sentences.english: The river is too dangerous to navigate.
sentences.chinese: 这河道太危险，不适宜航行。

detailed_translations.english: to sail along a river or other area of water

name: spawn
trans: v. 产卵；酿成，造成；大量生产；（人）生（孩子，多指不想要的孩子） n. 卵；菌丝；产物

sentences.english: ...her passion for collecting frog spawn.
sentences.chinese: ...她对采蛙卵的热爱。

detailed_translations.english: the eggs of a fish or  frog  laid together in a soft mass

detailed_translations.chinese: 产卵；酿成，造成；大量生产
detailed_translations.english: to make a series of things happen or start to exist

name: wildebeest
trans: n. 羚羊的一种；牛羚（又名角马）（产于非洲）

sentences.english: Next there are springbok and kudu, then wildebeest and zebra, grazing in a private game reserve.
sentences.chinese: 接着又有羚羊和条纹羚，牛羚和斑马，它们被放养在私人野生动物保护地里。

sentences.english: The farmer on the green side had been forcing his cattle to mimic the great migratory wildebeest herds of the Serengeti.
sentences.chinese: 绿色一边的农民一直强迫自己的牛模仿塞伦盖蒂平原庞大的洄游牛羚群。

sentences.english: All I had to do was bring the groceries, which meant a steak — which I thought could fill in for wildebeest or antelope — and a turnip, a mango, some peanuts and potatoes.
sentences.chinese: 我所要做的就是带一些食品(一个牛排)过去，我认为超市的牛排可以代替非洲草原的牛羚肉或羚羊肉，以及一些萝卜，芒果，花生和土豆之类。

detailed_translations.english: a large Southern African animal with a tail and curved horns

name: blowgun
trans: n. 吹箭筒；喷漆的器具

name: curious
trans: adj. 好奇的，有求知欲的；古怪的；爱挑剔的

sentences.english: Puppies are naturally curious.
sentences.chinese: 小狗天生好奇。

sentences.english: He felt a curious mixture of excitement and panic.
sentences.chinese: 他有一种既兴奋又惊慌的奇怪感觉。

detailed_translations.english: wanting to know about something

name: relieved
trans: adj. 感到宽慰的，放心的，不再忧虑的 v. 减轻，解除，缓解；调剂，使有趣；接替，换岗；解围；方便（上厕所的委婉说法）（relieve 的过去式和过去分词）

sentences.english: A relieved smile spread over his face.
sentences.chinese: 他脸上绽开了宽慰的笑容。

name: restless
trans: adj. 焦躁不安的；不安宁的；得不到满足的

sentences.english: After a few weeks in Marseille, I grew restless and decided to move on.
sentences.chinese: 在马赛住了几星期后，我开始待不住了，决定换个地方。

detailed_translations.english: unwilling to keep still or stay where you are, especially because you are nervous or bored

name: wander
trans: vi. 徘徊；漫步；迷路；离题 vt. 游荡，漫游 n. (Wander)人名；(英)万德(女子教名)

sentences.english: She wandered aimlessly around the streets.
sentences.chinese: 她在大街上漫无目的地到处游荡。

sentences.english: Pauline started to wander from the point.
sentences.chinese: 保利娜开始偏题了。

sentences.english: Don’t let any of the kids wander off.
sentences.chinese: 不要让任何一个小孩走开去。

detailed_translations.english: to walk slowly across or around an area, usually without a clear direction or purpose

name: ballet
trans: n. 芭蕾舞，芭蕾舞曲，芭蕾舞剧；芭蕾舞团；芭蕾式交流 n. (Ballet) （法、美）巴莱（人名）

sentences.english: She wants to be a ballet dancer .
sentences.chinese: 她想当芭蕾舞演员。

sentences.english: We’re going to the ballet tomorrow evening.
sentences.chinese: 我们明天晚上要去看芭蕾舞演出。

detailed_translations.english: a style of dancing that tells a dramatic story with music but no talking or singing

name: career
trans: n. 生涯；职业；事业；速度，全速 adj. 作为毕生职业的 vi. 全速前进，猛冲

sentences.english: a teaching career
sentences.chinese: 教学事业

sentences.english: He realized that his acting career was over.
sentences.chinese: 他意识到自己的演艺事业已走到了尽头。

sentences.english: a physiotherapist who wanted to make a dramatic career change by becoming an author
sentences.chinese: 想彻底改行当作家的理疗师

sentences.english: Nurses want an improved career structure (= better opportunities to move upwards in their jobs ) .
sentences.chinese: 护士希望有更好的职业架构。

detailed_translations.english: the series of jobs that a person has in a particular area of work, usually involving more responsibility as time passes

name: choreographer
trans: n. 编舞者，舞蹈指导

sentences.english: My choreographer keeps chiseling away at me, hoping to shape me into perfection.
sentences.chinese: 我的舞蹈编导总是不断雕琢我，一心将我塑造成完美的舞蹈家。

sentences.english: "A choreographer told me that what professionals are looking for in a good dancer is core body strength, " said Dr Neave.
sentences.chinese: “一个舞蹈编导告诉我专家们寻找优秀舞蹈演员的核心指标就是身体力量，”内尔博士透露。

sentences.english: The old master even invited him over to his house, where Jackson taught the moonwalk to him and his choreographer Hermes Pan.
sentences.chinese: 这位老前辈甚至邀请他到家里来，在这儿杰克逊为阿斯泰尔和他的舞蹈教练展示了太空步。

detailed_translations.english: A choreographer is someone who invents the movements for a ballet or other dance and tells the dancers how to perform them

name: company
trans: n. 公司；陪伴，同伴

sentences.english: Which company do you work for?
sentences.chinese: 你在哪家公司上班？

sentences.english: I called the phone company about the bill.
sentences.chinese: 我就电话账单的事给电话公司打了电话。

sentences.english: The company was set up just after the war.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司是战后不久成立的。

sentences.english: People judge you by the company you keep (= the people you spend time with ) .
sentences.chinese: 人们根据你交往的朋友来判断你的为人。

detailed_translations.english: a business organization that makes or sells goods or services

name: grace
trans: n. 优雅；恩惠；魅力；慈悲 vt. 使优美 n. (Grace)人名；(英)格雷斯，格雷丝 (女名)；(法)格拉斯

sentences.english: Lena moved with the grace of a dancer.
sentences.chinese: 莉娜走路姿势有着舞者般的优美。

sentences.english: He conducted himself with grace and dignity throughout the trial.
sentences.chinese: 在整个审讯过程中他表现得文雅而有尊严。

detailed_translations.english: a smooth way of moving that looks natural, relaxed, and attractive

name: reservation
trans: n. 预约，预订；保留

sentences.english: a dinner reservation
sentences.chinese: 预订晚餐

sentences.english: Customers are advised to make seat reservations well in advance.
sentences.chinese: 建议顾客提前订座。

detailed_translations.english: an arrangement which you make so that a place in a hotel, restaurant, plane etc is kept for you at a particular time in the future

name: belongings
trans: n. [经] 财产，所有物；亲戚

sentences.english: an insurance policy that covers your personal belongings
sentences.chinese: 一张承保个人财物的保单

detailed_translations.english: the things you own, especially things that you can carry with you

name: limited
trans: adj. 有限的 n. 高级快车

sentences.english: My knowledge of the business is limited.
sentences.chinese: 我对这一行了解有限。

sentences.english: The organization has very limited resources.
sentences.chinese: 这家机构资源非常有限。

sentences.english: So far, the education reforms have had only limited success.
sentences.chinese: 迄今为止，教育改革只取得了有限的成效。

detailed_translations.english: not very great in amount, number, ability etc

name: mature
trans: adj. 成熟的；充分考虑的；到期的；成年人的 vi. 成熟；到期 vt. 使…成熟；使…长成；慎重作出

sentences.english: Laura is very mature for her age.
sentences.chinese: 相对她的年龄来说劳拉是很成熟的。

sentences.english: We’re mature enough to disagree on this issue but still respect each other.
sentences.chinese: 我们都很成熟，尽管我们对此事意见不同，但还是彼此尊重。

sentences.english: As the fish matures, its colours and patternings change.
sentences.chinese: 随着发育成熟，这种鱼的颜色和斑纹都会改变。

detailed_translations.english: someone, especially a child or young person, who is mature behaves in a sensible and reasonable way, as you would expect an adult to behave
to become fully grown or developed

name: reunion
trans: n. 重聚；（班级或学校的）同学会，同窗会

sentences.english: an annual reunion
sentences.chinese: 一年一度的聚会

sentences.english: a family reunion
sentences.chinese: 家庭聚会

sentences.english: a high-school reunion
sentences.chinese: 高中同学联谊聚会

detailed_translations.english: a social meeting of people who have not met for a long time, especially people who were at school or college together

name: settlement
trans: n. 解决，处理；[会计] 结算；沉降；殖民

sentences.english: Union leaders and company bosses will meet tomorrow in an attempt to reach a settlement .
sentences.chinese: 工会领导人和公司老板将于明天举行会议以期达成协议。

sentences.english: His lawyers are understood to be negotiating a settlement .
sentences.chinese: 据说他的律师正在商谈一个协议。

sentences.english: Hopes grew that a workable peace settlement might emerge.
sentences.chinese: 达成一项可行的和平协定的希望越来越大。

sentences.english: She got her home as part of the divorce settlement .
sentences.chinese: 根据离婚协议，她拿到了房子。

sentences.english: The company paid out over $10 million in an out-of-court settlement .
sentences.chinese: 这家公司花了1,000多万美元进行庭外和解。

detailed_translations.chinese: 解决； 协议； 居留地， 小社区
detailed_translations.english: an official agreement or decision that ends an argument, a court case, or a fight, or the action of making an agreement

name: tend
trans: vi. 趋向，倾向；照料，照顾 vt. 照料，照管

sentences.english: Sofia was in the bedroom tending to her son.
sentences.chinese: 索菲娅在卧室里照料她的儿子。

detailed_translations.chinese: 照管， 照料， 护理
detailed_translations.english: to look after someone or something
if something tends to happen, it happens often and is likely to happen again

name: astronomer
trans: n. 天文学家

sentences.english: My ideal is to be an astronomer.
sentences.chinese: 我的理想是当一个天文学家。

sentences.english: If people know you’re an astronomer, they will soon be asking you all about it.
sentences.chinese: 如果有人知道你是个天文学家，他们会很快向你询问关于这件事的一切。

sentences.english: Any astronomer, at any university, in any country can write a proposal for what they want to do with the telescope.
sentences.chinese: 任何国家、任何大学的天文学家都可以递交申请，告诉我们他们想要使用这台望远镜做什么。

detailed_translations.english: a scientist who studies the stars and  planet s

name: atmosphere
trans: n. 气氛；大气；空气

sentences.english: The hotel had a lovely relaxed atmosphere .
sentences.chinese: 那家宾馆的气氛轻松愉快。

sentences.english: The atmosphere at home was rather tense.
sentences.chinese: 家里的气氛很紧张。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling that an event or place gives you

name: canyon
trans: n. 峡谷

sentences.english: The canyon is famous for producing echoes.
sentences.chinese: 这个峡谷以回声而闻名。

sentences.english: The grand canyon was not dug by the hand of man, but riven by nature.
sentences.chinese: 大峡谷并非人力所开而是受大自然之力而成的。

sentences.english: We made our way up the fixed rope and then down into a deeper third canyon.
sentences.chinese: 我们沿着固定的绳索前进，然后到达了一个更深的峡谷，这已经是第三个了。

detailed_translations.english: a deep valley with very steep sides of rock that usually has a river running through it

name: filter
trans: n. 过滤器；滤波器；筛选程序；分流指示灯 v. 过滤；渗透；用过滤法除去；慢慢传开；缓行；仅可左转行驶 n. (Filter) （德）菲尔特（人名）

sentences.english: The water in the tank is constantly filtered.
sentences.chinese: 鱼缸里的水在不停地被过滤。

sentences.english: The ozone layer filters harmful UV rays from the sun.
sentences.chinese: 臭氧层过滤掉有害的太阳紫外线。

sentences.english: coffee filter papers
sentences.chinese: 咖啡滤纸

sentences.english: filter cigarettes (= with a filter at the end )
sentences.chinese: 过滤嘴香烟

detailed_translations.english: to remove unwanted substances from water, air etc by passing it through a special substance or piece of equipment
something that you pass water, air etc through in order to remove unwanted substances and make it clean or suitable to use

name: rover
trans: n. 漫游者；流浪者；漂泊者；巡视器 n. (Rover)人名；(英)罗弗；(意)罗韦尔

detailed_translations.english: a person who roves; wanderer

name: solar system
trans: [天] 太阳系

sentences.english: Why do scientists think something could be hidden beyond the edge of our solar system?
sentences.chinese: 为什么科学家认为可能有某种东西潜藏在太阳系的边缘？

detailed_translations.english: the Sun and the  planets  that go around it

name: Buddha
trans: n. 佛陀；佛像

sentences.english: They knelt before the image of Buddha.
sentences.chinese: 他们在佛像面前下跪。

sentences.english: He has kept the figure of Buddha for luck.
sentences.chinese: 为了图吉利他一直保存着这尊佛像。

detailed_translations.english: Buddha is the title given to Gautama Siddhartha, the religious teacher and founder of Buddhism

name: culture
trans: n. 文化，文明；修养；栽培 vt. [细胞][微] 培养（等于cultivate）

sentences.english: We speak Danish at home so that the boys don’t lose touch with their language and culture.
sentences.chinese: 我们在家说丹麦语，这样男孩子们就不会脱离他们的语言和文化。

sentences.english: In our culture, it is rude to ask someone how much they earn.
sentences.chinese: 在我们的文化里，问别人收入多少是不礼貌的。

sentences.english: I love working abroad and meeting people from diffe-rent cultures.
sentences.chinese: 我喜欢在国外工作，认识来自不同文化的人。

detailed_translations.english: the beliefs, way of life, art, and customs that are shared and accepted by people in a particular society

name: cycle
trans: n. 循环；周期；自行车；整套；一段时间 vt. 使循环；使轮转 vi. 循环；骑自行车；轮转

sentences.english: a woman’s menstrual cycle
sentences.chinese: 女性的月经周期

detailed_translations.chinese: 自行车、 摩托车； 循环
detailed_translations.english: a number of related events that happen again and again in the same order

name: priest
trans: n. 牧师；神父；教士 vt. 使成为神职人员；任命…为祭司 n. (Priest)人名；(英、德)普里斯特

sentences.english: He had trained to be a Catholic priest.
sentences.chinese: 他接受培训成了一名天主教神父。

detailed_translations.english: someone who is specially trained to perform religious duties and ceremonies in the Christian church

detailed_translations.chinese: 使成为神职人员；任命…为祭司

name: resolution
trans: n. [物] 分辨率；决议；解决；决心

sentences.english: Then, with sudden resolution, she stood up.
sentences.chinese: 然后，她突然很坚决地站了起来。

sentences.english: She made a resolution to visit her relatives more often.
sentences.chinese: 她决定要多走走亲戚。

detailed_translations.english: the quality of being resolute or determined

name: tradition
trans: n. 惯例，传统；传说

sentences.english: the traditions of South East Asia
sentences.chinese: 东南亚的传统

sentences.english: the tradition that the eldest son inherits the property
sentences.chinese: 长子继承家产的传统

sentences.english: By tradition, it’s the bride’s parents who pay for the wedding.
sentences.chinese: 根据传统习俗，婚礼的费用由新娘的父母承担。

detailed_translations.english: a belief, custom, or way of doing something that has existed for a long time, or these beliefs, customs etc in general

name: acrobat
trans: n. 杂技演员，特技演员；随机应变者；翻云覆雨者，善变者

sentences.english: The acrobat balanced himself on the high rope.
sentences.chinese: 杂技演员在高绳上保持平衡。

sentences.english: Leggy models and a child acrobat wait offstage at a pop music concert in Ulaanbaatar.
sentences.chinese: 乌兰巴托的一场流行音乐会会场外，一群美腿模特和一位少年杂技演员正在等待入场。

sentences.english: He also added a crotch belt, a unicycle-like seat and an acrobat’s trapeze for a footrest; all help to keep the operator in optimal flying position.
sentences.chinese: 此外，他还添加了三叉腰带、独轮车式车座、还有一个杂技演员所用的秋千，用来放脚。 所有这些装置，都能够帮助操作者保持良好的飞行位置。

detailed_translations.english: someone who entertains people by doing difficult physical actions such as walking on their hands or balancing on a high rope, especially at a  circus

name: audience
trans: n. 观众；听众；读者；接见；正式会见；拜会

sentences.english: The show attracts a regular audience of about 20 million.
sentences.chinese: 这个节目吸引了大约两千万固定观众收看。

sentences.english: Goya was one of the first painters to look for a wider audience for his work.
sentences.chinese: 戈雅是最早为自己的作品寻找更多观赏者的画家之一。

detailed_translations.english: the people who watch or listen to a particular programme, or who see or hear a particular artist’s, writer’s etc work

name: circus
trans: n. 马戏；马戏团

sentences.english: Piccadilly Circus
sentences.chinese: 皮卡迪利广场

detailed_translations.english: a group of people and animals who travel to different places performing skilful tricks as entertainment

name: recital
trans: n. 朗诵，吟诵；独奏会；背诵；独唱会

sentences.english: a piano recital
sentences.chinese: 钢琴独奏会

detailed_translations.chinese: 独奏会， 独唱会， 小型舞蹈表演会； 吟诵
detailed_translations.english: a performance of music or poetry, usually given by one performer

name: skit
trans: n. 讽刺文；滑稽短剧

sentences.english: ...clever skits on popular songs.
sentences.chinese: ...巧妙地讽刺流行歌曲的滑稽短剧。

detailed_translations.chinese: 幽默讽刺短剧； 讽刺文章
detailed_translations.english: a short humorous performance or piece of writing

name: adaptation
trans: n. 适应；改编；改编本，改写本

sentences.english: Branagh won two awards for his screen adaptation of Shakespeare's Henry the Fifth.
sentences.chinese: 布拉纳因他对莎士比亚的《亨利五世》的荧幕改编而获了两次奖。

detailed_translations.chinese: 适应；改编；改编本，改写本
detailed_translations.english: a film or television programme that is based on a book or play

name: attack
trans: n. 攻击；抨击；疾病发作 vt. 攻击；抨击；动手干 vi. 攻击；腐蚀 n. (Attack)人名；(瑞典)阿塔克

sentences.english: a bomb attack
sentences.chinese: 炸弹袭击

sentences.english: a knife attack
sentences.chinese: 持刀攻击

sentences.english: an arson attack
sentences.chinese: 纵火袭击

sentences.english: victims of racial attacks
sentences.chinese: 种族袭击的受害者

detailed_translations.chinese: 攻击， 进攻； 突然发作
detailed_translations.english: an act of violence that is intended to hurt a person or damage a place

name: prey
trans: n. 猎物；受害者，牺牲品；（情绪易受伤的）脆弱的人；掠夺品 v. 捕食；伤害；折磨，困扰 n. (Prey) （美、德、爱）普赖（人名）

sentences.english: a tiger stalking its prey
sentences.chinese: 潜行跟踪猎物的老虎

sentences.english: Cats prey on birds and mice.
sentences.chinese: 猫捕食鸟和老鼠。

detailed_translations.english: an animal, bird etc that is hunted and eaten by another animal
(of an animal or a bird) to hunt and kill another animal for food

name: survive
trans: vt. 幸存；生还；幸免于；比...活得长 vi. 幸存；活下来

sentences.english: Only 12 of the 140 passengers survived.
sentences.chinese: 140 名乘客中只有 12 人生还。

sentences.english: She survived the attack.
sentences.chinese: 她在袭击中幸免于难。

sentences.english: people who survive cancer
sentences.chinese: 癌症幸存者

detailed_translations.chinese: 活下来，继续存在；幸免于
detailed_translations.english: to continue to live after an accident, war, or illness

detailed_translations.chinese: 从中挺过来； 从…逃出； 比…活得长
detailed_translations.english: to continue to live normally in spite of many problems

name: expert
trans: n. 专家；行家；能手 adj. 熟练的；内行的；老练的 v. 当专家 n. (Expert) （法、印、俄、罗、巴、荷）埃克斯佩（人名）

sentences.english: ...a yoga expert.
sentences.chinese: …一位瑜伽专家。

detailed_translations.english: someone who has a special skill or special knowledge of a subject, gained as a result of training or experience

name: national
trans: adj. 国家的；国民的；民族的；国立的 n. 国民

sentences.english: Religion matters very much at a national level.
sentences.chinese: 宗教事务在全国都非常重要。

sentences.english: Between 1929 and 1933 America’s national income fell by more than half.
sentences.chinese: 1929至1933年间，美国的国民收入下降过半。

sentences.english: There are strong indications that the Prime Minister will call national elections in May.
sentences.chinese: 有明显迹象预示首相将于5月召集全国大选。

detailed_translations.english: related to a whole nation as opposed to any of its parts

name: public
trans: adj. 公众的；政府的；公用的；公立的 n. 公众；社会；公共场所 n. (Public)人名；(英)帕布利克

sentences.english: We have to show that publishing this story is in the public interest (= helpful or useful to ordinary people ) .
sentences.chinese: 我们必须证明刊登这篇报道有利于公众。

sentences.english: full public access to information
sentences.chinese: 公众对信息的充分知情权

sentences.english: Public opinion is gradually shifting in favor of the imprisoned men.
sentences.chinese: 舆论渐渐倾向于同情入狱的男子。

sentences.english: There was a public outcry (= expression of anger by a lot of people ) about the shooting.
sentences.chinese: 公众就枪击事件发出了强烈抗议。

sentences.english: Their activities have been hidden from the public gaze (= people’s eyes or attention ) .
sentences.chinese: 他们的活动一直在避开公众的视线。

sentences.english: He is adored by his public.
sentences.chinese: 他深受支持者喜爱。

detailed_translations.english: relating to all the ordinary people in a country, who are not members of the government or do not have important jobs
ordinary people who do not work for the government or have any special position in society

name: visitor
trans: n. 访问者，参观者；视察者；候鸟

sentences.english: Times Square attracts more than 30 million visitors annually.
sentences.chinese: 时代广场每年吸引三千多万游客。

detailed_translations.chinese: 访问者，参观者；视察者；候鸟
detailed_translations.english: someone who comes to visit a place or a person

name: forge
trans: v. 锻造，铸造；缔造，艰苦做成；伪造；稳步前进，匀速移动 n. 锻铁炉，锻造车间，锻造厂；铁匠铺；伪造者 n. (Forge) （美）福格（人名）

sentences.english: Someone stole my credit card and forged my signature.
sentences.chinese: 有人偷了我的信用卡，并假冒我的签名。

sentences.english: a forged passport
sentences.chinese: 假护照

detailed_translations.english: to move somewhere or continue doing something in a steady determined way
to illegally copy something, especially something printed or written, to make people think that it is real
a place where metal is heated and shaped into objects

name: griddle
trans: n. 矿筛；煎饼用浅锅 vt. 筛 vi. 用锅煎

name: harness
trans: n. 马具；背带，吊带；甲胄；挽具状带子；降落伞背带；日常工作 v. 治理，利用；套；驾驭；披上甲胄；将（两只动物）拴在一起

sentences.english: We can harness the power of the wind to generate electricity.
sentences.chinese: 我们可以利用风力发电。

detailed_translations.english: to control and use the natural force or power of something

name: lumberjack
trans: n. 伐木工人；木材商的佣工；短茄克衫

name: bronco
trans: n. 野马（美国西部的） n. (Bronco)人名；(葡)布龙科

name: embers
trans: n. 余烬；余火；小火苗（ember的复数形式）

name: lasso
trans: n. 套索 vt. 用套索套捕；拉拢 n. (Lasso)人名；(西、意)拉索

sentences.english: As an engineer, I liked the look of the lasso idea and bought one.
sentences.chinese: 作为一名工程师，我非常喜欢这个套索的创意和外形，所以立刻就买了一个。

sentences.english: Where the Marlboro Man juggled cigarettes with a coiled lasso or a horse, Mr Landers tended to kick about in New England snow.
sentences.chinese: 在万宝路男人用一条盘绕的套索或一匹马耍弄香烟之处，兰德斯先生则往往是在新英格兰的雪中游荡。

detailed_translations.english: a rope with one end tied in a circle, used to catch cattle and horses, especially in the western US

name: pioneer
trans: n. 先锋；拓荒者 vt. 开辟；倡导；提倡 vi. 作先驱

sentences.english: the early pioneers of the Dakota territory
sentences.chinese: 达科他地区的早期拓荒者

detailed_translations.english: someone who is important in the early development of something, and whose work or ideas are later developed by other people
to be the first person to do, invent or use something

name: tyke
trans: n. 劣犬；野狗；（苏格兰）乡下佬；小孩子

name: ancient
trans: adj. 古代的；古老的，过时的；年老的 n. 古代人；老人

sentences.english: the ancient civilizations of Asia
sentences.chinese: 亚洲的古代文明

sentences.english: an ancient walled city
sentences.chinese: 有城墙的古城

detailed_translations.english: belonging to a time long ago in history, especially thousands of years ago

name: asteroid
trans: n. [天] 小行星；[无脊椎] 海盘车；小游星 adj. 星状的

sentences.english: Astronomers have detected an asteroid not far from Earth, moving in the same orbit around the Sun.
sentences.chinese: 天文学家在距离地球不远处发现一颗与地球绕日轨道相同的小行星。

sentences.english: Look at the movies that we see all the time. It's easy to imagine the end of the world. An asteroid destroying all life and so on.
sentences.chinese: 瞧瞧那些我们一直在看的电影，要想像世界末日那是很容易的事，比如一个小行星毁灭了所有生命之类的。

sentences.english: Moving on through the asteroid belt we enter the realms of the gas giant planets: Jupiter, Saturn, Uranus and Neptune, all of which dwarf the Earth.
sentences.chinese: 穿过小行星带继续前进，我们进入了气体巨行星区域：木星、土星、天王星、海王星，所有这些都使地球看起来像个侏儒。

detailed_translations.english: one of the many small  planet s  that move around the Sun, especially between Mars and Jupiter

name: myth
trans: n. 神话；虚构的人，虚构的事

sentences.english: a book of Greek myths
sentences.chinese: 一本关于希腊神话的图书

sentences.english: the giants of myth and fairytale
sentences.chinese: 神话和童话里的巨人

detailed_translations.english: an ancient story, especially one invented in order to explain natural or historical events

name: orbit
trans: n. 轨道；眼眶；势力范围；生活常规 vi. 盘旋；绕轨道运行 vt. 绕…轨道而行

sentences.english: Mars and Earth have orbits which change with time.
sentences.chinese: 火星和地球的轨道随着时间而发生改变。

detailed_translations.english: the curved path travelled by an object which is moving around another much larger object such as the Earth, the Sun etc
to travel in a curved path around a much larger object such as the Earth, the Sun etc

name: universe
trans: n. 宇宙；世界；领域

sentences.english: Einstein's equations showed the universe to be expanding.
sentences.chinese: 爱因斯坦的方程式表明宇宙正在扩大。

detailed_translations.english: all space, including all the stars and planets

name: allow
trans: vt. 允许；给予；认可 vi. 容许；考虑

sentences.english: We don’t allow diving in the pool.
sentences.chinese: 泳池内禁止跳水。

detailed_translations.english: to let someone do or have something, or let something happen

name: kernel
trans: n. 核心，要点；[计] 内核；仁；麦粒，谷粒；精髓

sentences.english: The kernel of that message was that peace must not be a source of advantage or disadvantage for anyone.
sentences.chinese: 那一信息的核心是和平绝不应该成为对任何人有利或不利的根源。

detailed_translations.chinese: 核心，要点；[计] 内核；仁；麦粒，谷粒；精髓
detailed_translations.english: the part of a nut or seed inside the shell, or the part inside the stone of some fruits

name: kettle
trans: n. 壶；[化工] 釜；罐；鼓 n. (Kettle)人名；(英)凯特尔

sentences.english: She filled the kettle and switched it on.
sentences.chinese: 她把水壶灌满，打开了开关。

sentences.english: The kettle’s boiling (= the water in it is boiling ).
sentences.chinese: 水壶里的水开了。

sentences.english: (= start boiling water in a kettle ), will you?
sentences.chinese: 烧壶水，好吗？

sentences.english: Put the meat into a small kettle.
sentences.chinese: 把肉放进一个小锅里。

detailed_translations.english: a container with a lid, a handle, and a spout,used for boiling and pouring water

name: machine
trans: n. 机械，机器；机构；机械般工作的人 vt. 用机器制造 n. (Machine)人名；(意)马基内

sentences.english: Could you get me a coffee from the drinks machine ?
sentences.chinese: 给我从自动饮料机里买一罐咖啡好吗？

sentences.english: The fax machine is broken.
sentences.chinese: 传真机坏了。

sentences.english: Did you put my dirty shirts in the machine (= washing machine ) ?
sentences.chinese: 你把我的脏衬衫放进洗衣机里了吗？

sentences.english: I left a message for you on your machine (= telephone answering machine ) .
sentences.chinese: 我在你的电话答录机里留了言。

sentences.english: The machine wouldn’t let me have any money (= cash machine ) .
sentences.chinese: 自动取款机不让我取钱。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of equipment with moving parts that uses power such as electricity to do a particular job

name: microwave
trans: n. 微波

sentences.english: Its molecules can be agitated by microwave energy.
sentences.chinese: 微波能量可以使其分子随之运动。

detailed_translations.english: a very short electric wave that is used in cooking food and sending messages by radio, and in radar

name: account
trans: n. 账户；解释；账目，账单；理由；描述 vi. 解释；导致；报账 vt. 认为；把…视为

sentences.english: My salary is paid into my bank account.
sentences.chinese: 我的工资直接存入我的银行账户。

sentences.english: I’ve opened an account with Barclay’s Bank.
sentences.chinese: 我在巴克莱银行开了一个账户。

sentences.english: My husband and I have a joint account (=  one that is shared between two people  ) .
sentences.chinese: 我和丈夫有个联名账户。

detailed_translations.english: an arrangement in which a bank keeps your money safe so that you can pay more in or take money out

name: borrower
trans: n. 借款人，借方

name: expense
trans: n. 损失，代价；消费；开支 vt. 向…收取费用 vi. 被花掉

sentences.english: He borrowed £150,000 and used the money for legal expenses.
sentences.chinese: 他借了15万英镑用于支付律师费。

sentences.english: Conference rooms were equipped at great expense.
sentences.chinese: 装备会议室花费巨大。

detailed_translations.chinese: 花费， 消费， 费用； 开支， 业务费用
detailed_translations.english: the amount of money that you spend on something

name: interest
trans: n. 兴趣，爱好；利息；利益；趣味；同行 vt. 使……感兴趣；引起……的关心；使……参与

sentences.english: I watched the first few episodes, but soon lost interest.
sentences.chinese: 我看了前几集，但很快就失去了兴趣。

sentences.english: The last round of bidding aroused considerable interest.
sentences.chinese: 最后一轮竞价引起人们相当大的兴趣。

sentences.english: Our survey reveals a disturbing lack of interest in teacher training.
sentences.chinese: 我们的调查显示人们对教师培训失去了兴趣，这很令人不安。

sentences.english: I read your article with great interest.
sentences.chinese: 我兴致勃勃地拜读了您的文章。

sentences.english: to promote/protect/safeguard sb's interests
sentences.chinese: 为某人的利益游说；保护 / 维护某人的利益

sentences.english: The money was repaid with interest.
sentences.chinese: 这笔钱是带息偿还的。

detailed_translations.english: the feeling that you have when you want to know or learn more about sb/sth

name: statement
trans: n. 声明；陈述，叙述；报表，清单

sentences.english: In an official statement, she formally announced her resignation.
sentences.chinese: 在一份官方声明中，她正式宣布辞职。

detailed_translations.chinese: 陈述， 声明； 结算单， 报表
detailed_translations.english: something you say or write, especially publicly or officially, to let people know your intentions or opinions, or to record facts

name: attraction
trans: n. 吸引，吸引力；引力；吸引人的事物

sentences.english: Sexual attraction is a large part of falling in love.
sentences.chinese: 堕入爱河很大部分是由于性吸引。

sentences.english: gravitational/magnetic attraction
sentences.chinese: 地心引力；磁力

detailed_translations.english: a feeling of liking sb, especially sexually

name: billboard
trans: n. 广告牌；布告板 vt. 宣传；介绍

sentences.english: Or put it on your busines card, billboard or a bumper sticker.
sentences.chinese: 或者把它放在你的名片、布告板、或者缓冲器中。

sentences.english: I tell teams working on print ads to start by creating a billboard.
sentences.chinese: 我告诉平面广告的工作团队，从制作一个广告牌开始。

sentences.english: Stop being some company's billboard, and show us YOU.
sentences.chinese: 停止做公司的广告牌，向我们展示 你自己 。

detailed_translations.english: a large sign used for advertising

name: monument
trans: n. 纪念碑；历史遗迹；不朽的作品 vt. 为…树碑

sentences.english: He erected a monument on the spot where his daughter was killed.
sentences.chinese: 他在女儿遇难的地方立了块纪念碑。

detailed_translations.chinese: 纪念碑；历史遗迹；不朽的作品
detailed_translations.english: a building,  statue  , or other large structure that is built to remind people of an important event or famous person

name: replica
trans: n. 复制品，仿制品；模型；摹本

sentences.english: replica guns
sentences.chinese: 仿真枪

detailed_translations.english: an exact copy of something, especially a building, a gun, or a work of art

name: tourist
trans: n. 旅行者，观光客 adj. 旅游的 vt. 在旅行参观 vi. 旅游；观光 adv. 坐旅游车厢；坐经济舱

sentences.english: Cambridge is always full of tourists in the summer.
sentences.chinese: 剑桥在夏季总是挤满了游客。

sentences.english: The Statue of Liberty is a major tourist attraction .
sentences.chinese: 自由女神像是主要的旅游景点。

sentences.english: What effect will this have on the local tourist industry ?
sentences.chinese: 这对当地的旅游业会有什么影响？

detailed_translations.english: someone who is visiting a place for pleasure on holiday

name: autumn
trans: n. 秋天；成熟期；渐衰期，凋落期 adj. 秋天的，秋季的 n. (Autumn)人名；(英)奥特姆

sentences.english: autumn mists
sentences.chinese: 秋天的雾霭

detailed_translations.english: the season between summer and winter, when leaves change colour and the weather becomes cooler

trans: n. 范围；幅度；排；山脉 vi. （在...内）变动；平行，列为一行；延伸；漫游；射程达到 vt. 漫游；放牧；使并列；归类于；来回走动

if a liquid evaporates, or if heat evaporates it, it changes into a gas

sentences.chinese: 新英格兰风光之美

sentences.chinese: 事情过去二十年了，他的死仍然是个谜。

sentences.chinese: 警察一直没有侦破格雷失踪的谜案。

to gather crops from the fields

name: Pilgrim
trans: n. 朝圣者；漫游者；（美）最初的移民 vi. 去朝圣；漫游 n. (Pilgrim)人名；(英、德)皮尔格林

name: survival
trans: n. 幸存，残存；幸存者，残存物

sentences.english: The doctors gave him a one in ten chance of survival .
sentences.chinese: 医生说他有十分之一的生存希望。

sentences.english: The cult is a survival from the old Zoroastrian religion.
sentences.chinese: 这种膜拜仪式是古老的拜火教遗留下来的。

detailed_translations.english: the state of continuing to live or exist

name: agility
trans: n. 敏捷；灵活；机敏

sentences.english: If for some reason you don't have or cannot adopt these values, then you should not worry about agility.
sentences.chinese: 如果因为某些原因您没有或者不能采用这些价值，那么您就不需要为敏捷而操心了。

sentences.english: The boy came upstairs with agility .
sentences.chinese: 那男孩敏捷地走上楼来。

name: athlete
trans: n. 运动员，体育家；身强力壮的人

sentences.english: a professional athlete
sentences.chinese: 一位专业运动员

detailed_translations.english: someone who competes in sports competitions, especially running, jumping, and throwing

name: endurance
trans: n. 忍耐力；耐久性；持续时间

sentences.english: She was pushed beyond her powers of endurance.
sentences.chinese: 她被逼得忍无可忍。

sentences.english: The marathon is a test of endurance.
sentences.chinese: 马拉松赛跑是对耐力的考验。

detailed_translations.english: the ability to continue doing something difficult or painful over a long period of time

name: excel
trans: vt. 超过；擅长 vi. (在某方面)胜过(或超过)别人

sentences.english: You have excelled yourself with the new exhibition.
sentences.chinese: 你新办的这次展览特别成功。

detailed_translations.english: to do something very well, or much better than most people
to do something very well, or much better than most people

name: legend
trans: n. 传奇；说明；图例；刻印文字 n. (Legend)人名；(西)莱亨德；(英)莱金德

sentences.english: Local legend has it that (= says that ) the island was the original Garden of Eden.
sentences.chinese: 当地传说这个岛就是伊甸园的原型。

detailed_translations.english: an old, well-known story, often about brave people, adventures, or magical events

name: experiment
trans: n. 实验，试验；尝试 v. 尝试；试验；进行实验

sentences.english: The teacher provided some different materials and left the children to experiment.
sentences.chinese: 老师提供了几种不同的材料让孩子们试验。

detailed_translations.english: to try using various ideas, methods etc to find out how good or effective they are
a scientific test done to find out how something reacts under certain conditions, or to find out if a particular idea is true

name: filament
trans: n. 灯丝；细丝；细线；单纤维

sentences.english: The effect is caused by the escape of electrons from the hot filament .
sentences.chinese: 这个效应是由于电子从热灯丝逸出而引起的。

sentences.english: An inert gas such as argon is introduced to reduce evaporation of the filament .
sentences.chinese: 将诸如氩那样的惰性气体充入灯泡中，以减少灯丝的蒸发。

sentences.english: In the paper, the enhancing process of diamond nucleation by negative substrate bias in hot filament CVD system was analyzed.
sentences.chinese: 对利用热灯丝CVD沉积金刚石膜时负衬底偏压增强金刚石的核化过程进行了分析。

detailed_translations.english: A filament is a very thin piece or thread of something, for example, the piece of wire inside a light bulb

name: operator
trans: 经营者；操作员；运营商；话务员；行家

sentences.english: Hello, operator? Could you put me through to Room 31?
sentences.chinese: 喂，接线员吗？请帮我接31号房间。

sentences.english: computers which can be used by untrained operators
sentences.chinese: 未经训练的操作者也可使用的电脑

detailed_translations.english: someone who works on a telephone switchboard, who you can call for help

name: patent
trans: n. 专利权；专利证；专利品 adj. 专利的；特许生产或销售的；显著的；公开的；（脉管等）开放的 v. 取得……的专利权；授予专利

sentences.english: a patent lock
sentences.chinese: 专利锁

sentences.english: He held a number of patents for his many innovations.
sentences.chinese: 他为他的许多革新申请了几项专利。

detailed_translations.english: protected by a patent
A patent is an official right to be the only person or company allowed to make or sell a new product for a certain period of time.

name: delirious
trans: adj. 发狂的；神志昏迷的；精神错乱的

sentences.english: I was delirious and blacked out several times.
sentences.chinese: 我当时神志不清，几次昏过去。

detailed_translations.chinese: 发狂的；神志昏迷的；精神错乱的
detailed_translations.english: Someone who is delirious is unable to think or speak in a sensible and reasonable way, usually because they are very ill and have a fever

name: desperate
trans: adj. 不顾一切的；令人绝望的；极度渴望的

sentences.english: I had no money left and was desperate.
sentences.chinese: 我身无分文，已经走投无路了。

sentences.english: Time was running out and we were getting desperate .
sentences.chinese: 时间越来越少，我们越来越感到绝望。

sentences.english: the missing teenager’s desperate parents
sentences.chinese: 失踪少年绝望的父母

detailed_translations.english: willing to do anything to change a very bad situation, and not caring about danger

name: inherit
trans: vt. 继承；遗传而得 vi. 成为继承人

sentences.english: inherited wealth
sentences.chinese: 继承的财富

detailed_translations.english: to receive money, property etc from someone after they have died
to receive money, property etc from someone after they have died

name: ordeal
trans: n. 折磨；严酷的考验；痛苦的经验

sentences.english: He was beginning to wonder if he would survive the ordeal.
sentences.chinese: 他开始怀疑自己能否熬过这场磨难。

sentences.english: Teresa had a transplant in 1989 and was just recovering from that ordeal when she suffered a brain hemorrhage.
sentences.chinese: 特雷莎在1989年做了一次移植手术，而正当她刚刚从那可怕的磨难中逐渐恢复时，又患了脑溢血。

sentences.english: Soon the whole terrifying ordeal would be over.
sentences.chinese: 这场恐怖的磨难很快就会过去的。

detailed_translations.english: a terrible or painful experience that continues for a period of time

name: sap
trans: n. （植物的）液，汁；精力，元气；坑道，地道；（非正式）笨蛋，傻瓜；大头短棒，棍棒 v. 使衰竭，使伤元气；挖坑道；挖掘以破坏基础；（水等作用）逐渐侵蚀；用大头短棒击 n. (Sap) （印、乌克兰、美、法、荷）萨（人名）

sentences.english: The leaves, bark and sap are also common ingredients of local herbal remedies.
sentences.chinese: 树叶、树皮和树液也是当地草药疗法的常用药材。

detailed_translations.chinese: [植] 树液；精力，元气；活力；坑道
detailed_translations.english: the watery substance that carries food through a plant

detailed_translations.chinese: 使衰竭，使伤元气；挖掘以破坏基础

name: sturdy
trans: adj. 坚定的；强健的；健全的 n. 羊晕倒病 n. (Sturdy)人名；(英)斯特迪

sentences.english: That chair doesn’t look very sturdy.
sentences.chinese: 那把椅子看上去不太结实。

sentences.english: They kept up a sturdy opposition to the plan.
sentences.chinese: 他们一直坚决反对那项计划。

detailed_translations.english: (of an object) strong and not easily damaged

name: amputate
trans: vt. 截肢；切断；删除

sentences.english: Two of her toes were amputated because of frostbite.
sentences.chinese: 她的两个脚趾因为冻伤被截掉了。

detailed_translations.english: to cut off someone’s arm, leg, finger etc during a medical operation

name: dogsled
trans: n. （尤用于加拿大和阿拉斯加的）狗拉雪橇

name: hibernation
trans: n. 冬眠；过冬；避寒

sentences.english: "In fact, " she said after a while, "We have gone into hibernation.
sentences.chinese: “实际上，”过了一会儿，她说道，“我们已经被困在这里过冬了。

sentences.english: After all, he reasoned, some single-celled creatures are known to enter a hibernation-like state and survive for years with no air or food.
sentences.chinese: 毕竟，他推断，众所周知一些单细胞生物可以进入一种类似冬眠的状态，并在没有空气和水的状态下生存数年。

sentences.english: Heart rate tracking for three of the Alaska bears showed a drop from 55 beats per minute on average before hibernation to 14 erratic ones per minute in winter.
sentences.chinese: 对三头阿拉斯加的黑熊的心率追踪显示出它们在冬眠前的平均每分钟 55 下降低到了冬天里每分钟飘忽不定的 14 下。

name: Russian
trans: adj. 俄国的；俄语的 n. 俄语；俄国人

sentences.english: ...the Russian parliament.
sentences.chinese: ...俄罗斯国会。

detailed_translations.english: relating to Russia, its people, or its language
someone from Russia

name: superhero
trans: n. 超级英雄

sentences.english: ...superheroes like Batman and Superman.
sentences.chinese: ...像蝙蝠侠和超人那样的超级英雄。

detailed_translations.english: a character in stories who uses special powers, such as great strength or the ability to fly, to help people

name: unpredictable
trans: adj. 不可预知的；不定的；出乎意料的 n. 不可预言的事

sentences.english: He is utterly unpredictable.
sentences.chinese: 他这个人完全让人捉摸不透。

detailed_translations.chinese: 不可预知的；不定的；出乎意料的
detailed_translations.english: If you describe someone or something as unpredictable, you mean that you cannot tell what they are going to do or how they are going to behave

name: characteristic
trans: adj. 典型的；特有的；表示特性的 n. 特征；特性；特色

sentences.english: the highly characteristic (= very typical ) flint walls of the local houses
sentences.chinese: 当地房子非常有特色的燧石墙

sentences.english: Violent images are a defining characteristic of his work.
sentences.chinese: 暴力形象是他作品的一个鲜明特征。

detailed_translations.english: very typical of a particular thing or of someone’s character
a quality or feature of something or someone that is typical of them and easy to recognize

name: personality
trans: n. 个性；品格；名人

sentences.english: Despite their different personalities, they became the best of friends.
sentences.chinese: 尽管个性不同，他们还是成了最好的朋友。

sentences.english: Unfortunately, the illness can lead to changes in personality.
sentences.chinese: 不幸的是，这种病会导致性格变化。

detailed_translations.english: someone’s character, especially the way they behave towards other people

name: sibling
trans: n. 兄弟姊妹；民族成员

sentences.english: Most young smokers are influenced by their friends’ and older siblings’ smoking habits.
sentences.chinese: 大多数年轻的吸烟者都是因为他们的朋友或者哥哥姐姐有吸烟习惯而受影响的。

detailed_translations.english: a brother or sister

name: twin
trans: n. 双胞胎中的一人；一对相似的事物之一 adj. 孪生的；双胞胎之一的；双生的；成双的；双重的 v. 使结成姐妹城市；使耦合；成对；生双胞胎 n. (Twin) 特温（人名）

sentences.english: I always confounded him with his twin brother.
sentences.chinese: 我总分不清他和他的孪生兄弟。

sentences.english: The twin brothers were removed from our class.
sentences.chinese: 这一对孪生兄弟已从我们班转走。

sentences.english: The twin brothers bled for their country and died without any regrets.
sentences.chinese: 这对孪生兄弟为国流血牺牲， 死而无憾。

name: Constitution
trans: n. 宪法；体制；章程；构造；建立，组成；体格

name: court
trans: n. 法院；球场；朝廷；奉承 vt. 招致（失败、危险等）；向…献殷勤；设法获得 vi. 求爱 n. (Court)人名；(英)考特；(法)库尔

sentences.english: It could not be proved in a court of law.
sentences.chinese: 这无法在法庭上证实。

sentences.english: The court case lasted six weeks.
sentences.chinese: 这场诉讼持续了六个星期。

sentences.english: Four people will appear in court today, charged with fraud.
sentences.chinese: 今天将有四个人因被指控犯有欺诈罪出庭受审。

sentences.english: The court ruled that no compensation was due.
sentences.chinese: 法庭判决不予赔偿。

sentences.english: She threatened to take the magazine to court (= take legal action against them ) if they didn’t publish an immediate apology.
sentences.chinese: 她威胁说如果这家杂志不立刻刊登道歉声明，她就要把他们告上法庭。

detailed_translations.english: the place where a trial is held, or the people there, especially the judge and the jury who examine the evidence and decide whether someone is guilty or not guilty

name: representative
trans: adj. 典型的，有代表性的；代议制的；表现的，体现的；与表象有关的 n. 代表；典型；众议员；销售代表

sentences.english: The latest incident is representative of a wider trend.
sentences.chinese: 最近发生的事件代表了一个更大的趋势。

sentences.english: an elected representative of the people
sentences.chinese: 民选代表

detailed_translations.english: typical of a particular group or thing
someone who has been chosen to speak, vote, or make decisions for someone else

name: baleen
trans: n. 鲸须，鲸骨

sentences.english: Large baleen whales are of special concern.
sentences.chinese: 大型鲸须鲸是最受关注的物种。

sentences.english: Surfacing in warm winter waters off the Baja California coast, a gray whale flashes its baleen plates by a boat.
sentences.chinese: 下加利福尼亚海岸（Baja California coast）附近，在冬日温暖的海水里，一条灰鲸浮在水面上，露出了鲸须板，旁边是一条船。

sentences.english: Unlike orca, which are odontocetes or toothed whales, humpbacks are mysticetes, harmless leviathans with only baleen plates in their mouths.
sentences.chinese: 座头鲸不像齿鲸亚目鲸或齿鲸，它们是须鲸亚目、无害的大海兽，嘴里只有须鲸板。

detailed_translations.english: whalebone

name: blowhole
trans: n. （鲸、海豚等的）喷水孔；（隧道等的）通风孔；岩石孔穴；[材] 气泡

sentences.english: The real nose however is the blowhole on top of the head.
sentences.chinese: 而真正的鼻孔其实是它们头顶的喷水孔。

name: blubber
trans: n. 鲸脂；哭泣 vi. 又哭又闹 vt. 又哭又闹 adj. 肿大的

detailed_translations.english: the fat of sea animals, especially  whale s

name: buoyant
trans: adj. 轻快的；有浮力的；上涨的

sentences.english: a buoyant economy
sentences.chinese: 欣欣向荣的经济

detailed_translations.chinese: 轻快的；有浮力的；上涨的
detailed_translations.english: buoyant prices etc tend to rise

name: extinction
trans: n. 灭绝；消失；消灭；废止

sentences.english: species in danger of extinction
sentences.chinese: 有灭绝危险的物种

sentences.english: They were hunted almost to extinction.
sentences.chinese: 它们遭受猎杀，几近灭绝。

sentences.english: Conservationists are trying to save the whale from extinction.
sentences.chinese: 生态环境保护工作者正努力挽救鲸类以防止其灭绝。

detailed_translations.english: when a particular type of animal or plant stops existing

name: digester
trans: n. （化）蒸煮器，煮解器；做摘要者，汇编者

name: sewage
trans: n. 污水；下水道；污物

sentences.english: Chlorine is used in sewage treatment.
sentences.chinese: 氯被用于污水处理。

sentences.english: The factory secretly dumped millions of gallons of raw sewage (= sewage that had not been treated ) into the Ohio river.
sentences.chinese: 这家工厂偷偷地把几百万加仑未经处理的污水排放进了俄亥俄河。

detailed_translations.english: the mixture of waste from the human body and used water, that is carried away from houses by pipes under the ground

name: sewer
trans: n. 下水道；阴沟；裁缝师 vt. 为…铺设污水管道；用下水道排除…的污水 vi. 清洗污水管

sentences.english: ...the city's sewer system.
sentences.chinese: …该城市的下水道系统。

detailed_translations.english: a pipe or passage under the ground that carries away waste material and used water from houses, factories etc

detailed_translations.chinese: 为…铺设污水管道；用下水道排除…的污水
detailed_translations.english: to provide with sewers
to provide with sewers

name: adapt
trans: vt. 使适应；改编 vi. 适应

sentences.english: The ability to adapt is a definite asset in this job.
sentences.chinese: 适应能力是做这份工作的绝对有利条件。

sentences.english: Many children buy books after they have been adapted for television.
sentences.chinese: 许多小孩子都是在书被改编成电视剧之后才去买的。

detailed_translations.english: to gradually change your behaviour and attitudes in order to be successful in a new situation

name: bred
trans: breed的过去式和过去分词

name: breed
trans: v. （使）动物繁殖；（动物）交配；（为某种目的而）培育（动、植物）；培养；滋生；（通过核反应）增殖可裂变物质 n. 品种；（人或物的）类型，种类；养殖；繁殖 n. (Breed) （美）布里德（人名）

sentences.english: Spaniels are my favourite breed of dog.
sentences.chinese: 西班牙猎犬是我最喜欢的犬种。

sentences.english: Eagles breed during the cooler months of the year.
sentences.chinese: 鹰在一年中较凉爽的季节交配繁殖。

detailed_translations.english: a type of animal that is kept as a pet or on a farm
if animals breed, they  mate in order to have babies

name: gene
trans: n. [遗] 基因，遗传因子

sentences.english: human genes
sentences.chinese: 人类基因

sentences.english: the genes that regulate cell division
sentences.chinese: 控制细胞分裂的基因

detailed_translations.english: a part of a cell in a living thing that controls what it looks like, how it grows, and how it develops. People get their genes from their parents

name: mutation
trans: n. 突变；变化；元音变化

sentences.english: The more people who have the virus, the more virus particles there are for that one, fatal mutation to appear in.
sentences.chinese: 因为如果有越多人感染到病毒，就有越多病毒颗粒可以酝酿出一种致命的突变病毒品种。

sentences.english: Analyzes the factors that influence the stretching changing in the hoisting process and put forward a method that adopting S-curve could reduce the stretching mutation.
sentences.chinese: 分析了提升过程中钢丝绳张力变化的影响因素，提出了采用S曲线速度图是可以减小张力突变的一种方法。

sentences.english: For example, it is hard to say whether an ART baby has died because of the ART technology or because one of its parents had a mutation that mutually contributed to subpar fertility and infant death.
sentences.chinese: 例如，很难说是否一个ART的宝宝会因为ART技术而死亡，或者他父母中的其中一个出现突变，这对于在平均水平以下的受精和婴儿的死亡是互相贡献的。

detailed_translations.english: a change in the  genetic  structure of an animal or plant that makes it different from others of the same kind

name: knit
trans: vi. 编织；结合；皱眉 vt. 编织；结合 n. 编织衣物；编织法

sentences.english: My grandmother taught me how to knit.
sentences.chinese: 我祖母教过我编织。

sentences.english: She’s knitting a sweater.
sentences.chinese: 她在织毛衣。

detailed_translations.english: to make clothing out of wool, using two knitting needles

name: nettle
trans: n. 荨麻，荨麻科 v. 惹怒，使恼火；用荨麻刺伤或鞭打（某人）

sentences.english: The nettles stung their legs.
sentences.chinese: 荨麻刺痛了他们的腿。

detailed_translations.english: a wild plant with rough leaves that sting you

name: perseverance
trans: n. 坚持不懈；不屈不挠 n. 耐性；毅力

sentences.english: He's a clever man,but fails in perseverance.
sentences.chinese: 他是一个聪明人，但缺乏毅力。

sentences.english: Their power does not come from rank or title but from intellect and perseverance.
sentences.chinese: 他们的权力并非来自等级或头衔，而是来自他们的智慧和毅力。

name: task
trans: n. （困难的）任务，工作；（语言教学中的）活动 v. 派给某人（任务）；对（手段或能力）要求极高

sentences.english: Sara had the task of preparing the agenda for meetings.
sentences.chinese: 萨拉的任务是准备会议议程。

sentences.english: I was given the task of building a fire.
sentences.chinese: 我分配到生火的任务。

sentences.english: the skills required to carry out these tasks
sentences.chinese: 执行这些任务所需要的技能

sentences.english: He soon realized the scale of the task he had undertaken .
sentences.chinese: 他很快就意识到他所承担任务的艰巨性了。

sentences.english: Our first task is to gather information.
sentences.chinese: 我们的首要任务是收集信息。

sentences.english: Monkeys can be taught to do simple tasks .
sentences.chinese: 猴子能被教会做一些简单的事。

sentences.english: They have the unenviable task of supervising the most dangerous prison in the country.
sentences.chinese: 他们有个令人头疼的工作，就是管理国家最危险的监狱。

sentences.english: Volunteers had the thankless task of distributing campaign leaflets.
sentences.chinese: 志愿者的任务是分发活动传单，吃力不讨好。

sentences.english: Trying to bring up a small daughter on your own is no easy task .
sentences.chinese: 独自抚养年幼的女儿不是件轻而易举的事。

detailed_translations.english: a piece of work that must be done, especially one that is difficult or unpleasant or that must be done regularly

name: utter
trans: adj. 完全的；彻底的；无条件的 v. 说出；发出，表达；发射；使用伪钞 n. (Utter) （美、瑞、德、加、法、俄、匈）乌特（人名）

sentences.english: That’s utter nonsense!
sentences.chinese: 真是一派胡言！

sentences.english: This company treats its employees with utter contempt.
sentences.chinese: 这家公司对其员工不屑一顾。

sentences.english: I watched in complete and utter horror as he pulled out a gun.
sentences.chinese: 我惊恐万分地看着他拔出枪来。

sentences.english: fifteen years of utter confusion
sentences.chinese: 15年的大混乱

detailed_translations.english: complete – used especially to emphasize that something is very bad, or that a feeling is very strong
to make a sound with your voice, especially with difficulty

name: actor
trans: n. 男演员；行动者；作用物

sentences.english: His father was an actor in the Cantonese Opera Company.
sentences.chinese: 他父亲曾是粤剧团的一名演员。

detailed_translations.english: someone who performs in a play or film

name: comedy
trans: n. 喜剧；喜剧性；有趣的事情

sentences.english: a career in stand-up comedy
sentences.chinese: 单口喜剧表演职业

detailed_translations.english: entertainment that is intended to make people laugh

name: history
trans: n. 历史，历史学；历史记录；来历

sentences.english: Throughout history the achievements of women have been largely ignored.
sentences.chinese: 从古至今，妇女的成就都被大大地忽视了。

sentences.english: No man in recent history has done more to rebuild the Democratic Party.
sentences.chinese: 他对重建民主党的贡献在近代史上无人能及。

sentences.english: the early history of Scotland
sentences.chinese: 苏格兰的早期历史

sentences.english: Other meteor storms have occurred in recorded history .
sentences.chinese: 在有记载的历史上发生过其他的流星暴。

sentences.english: a museum devoted to local history
sentences.chinese: 专门介绍当地历史的博物馆

sentences.english: one of the darkest episodes in American history
sentences.chinese: 美国历史上最黑暗的事件之一

sentences.english: an interesting period in Egyptian history
sentences.chinese: 埃及历史上一段有趣的时期

sentences.english: a decision that changed the course of history
sentences.chinese: 改变历史进程的决定

sentences.english: a college steeped in history
sentences.chinese: 一所历史悠久的学院

sentences.english: Your doctor will ask for your medical history.
sentences.chinese: 医生会询问你的病历。

detailed_translations.english: all the things that happened in the past, especially the political, social, or economic development of a nation

name: playwright
trans: n. 剧作家

sentences.english: The playwright does something remarkable in this scene, but without any impression of straining after an effect.
sentences.chinese: 剧作家在这场中有许多惊人妙笔，但并不给人留下竭力追求表面效果的印象。

sentences.english: His plays have been translated into every major living language and are performed more often than those of any other playwright.
sentences.chinese: 他的剧本被翻译成所有主要使用着的语言，并且表演次数远远超过其他任何剧作家。

sentences.english: His plays have been translated into every major living language and are performed more often than those of any other playwright.
sentences.chinese: 他的剧本被翻译成世界上多种主要语言，并且表演次数远远超过其他任何剧作家。

detailed_translations.english: someone who writes plays

name: popular
trans: adj. 流行的，通俗的；受欢迎的；大众的；普及的

sentences.english: Hilary was popular at school.
sentences.chinese: 希拉里在学校里很受欢迎。

sentences.english: a popular holiday resort
sentences.chinese: 人们喜欢的度假胜地

sentences.english: Coffee is probably the most popular drink in the world.
sentences.chinese: 咖啡很可能是世界上最受欢迎的饮料。

sentences.english: a popular movement for democracy
sentences.chinese: 争取民主的全民运动

detailed_translations.english: liked by a lot of people

name: tragedy
trans: n. 悲剧；灾难；惨案

sentences.english: The tragedy happened as they were returning home from a night out.
sentences.chinese: 悲剧发生在他们夜里外出归来的路上。

sentences.english: Tragedy struck the family when their two-year-old son was killed in an accident.
sentences.chinese: 悲剧降临到这个家庭，他们两岁的儿子在一次事故中丧生。

detailed_translations.english: a very sad event, that shocks people because it involves death

name: burrow
trans: v. 挖地洞，挖通道；依偎；挖穿；钻入；（使）……钻到……下面；（在……里）搜寻；深入查询 n. （动物的，尤指兔子挖的）洞穴，地洞 n. (Burrow) （美）伯罗（人名）

sentences.english: Normally timid, they rarely stray far from their burrows.
sentences.chinese: 它们通常很胆小，极少远离自己的洞穴。

sentences.english: The larvae burrow into cracks in the floor.
sentences.chinese: 幼虫钻进地板的裂缝中。

detailed_translations.english: a passage in the ground made by an animal such as a rabbit or  fox  as a place to live
If an animal burrows into the ground or into a surface, it moves through it by making a tunnel or hole

name: glide
trans: vi. 滑翔；滑行；悄悄地走；消逝 vt. 使滑行；使滑动 n. 滑翔；滑行；滑移；滑音

sentences.english: Waiters glide between tightly packed tables bearing trays of pasta.
sentences.chinese: 侍者们托着一盘盘的意大利面食在拥挤的餐桌间自如穿行。

detailed_translations.chinese: 滑翔；滑行；悄悄地走；消逝
detailed_translations.english: to move smoothly and quietly, as if without effort
a smooth quiet movement that seems to take no effort

name: larvae
trans: n. 幼虫，幼体（larva 的复数）

sentences.english: In fact, the animal uses its middle finger to find and harvest insect larvae in trees.
sentences.chinese: 实际上， 这种动物用其中指搜索和俘获藏在树木里的昆虫幼虫。

sentences.english: FLATOW: ...thank you, in their beaks, and poke in to pull out these larvae out of a tree.
sentences.chinese: 傅拉托：对，...谢谢你，是用它们的"喙"(鸟嘴)，把树枝戳进洞里去，把幼虫从树洞里钓出来。

sentences.english: We know that freshwater eels reproduce in the ocean because larvae have been found drifting near the surface thousands of miles from any shore.
sentences.chinese: 我们知道淡水鳗鱼在海里繁殖，因为我们曾经在距所有海岸数千英里的海面发现过漂动的鳗鱼幼体。

name: silk
trans: n. 丝绸；蚕丝；丝织物 adj. 丝的；丝绸的；丝制的 vi. （玉米）处于长须的阶段中 n. (Silk)人名；(英、瑞典)西尔克

sentences.english: pure silk stockings
sentences.chinese: 生丝面料的漂亮连衣裙

detailed_translations.english: a thin smooth soft cloth made from very thin thread which is produced by a silkworm

name: tropical
trans: adj. 热带的；热情的；酷热的

sentences.english: the tropical rain forests
sentences.chinese: 热带雨林

sentences.english: tropical fruit
sentences.chinese: 热带水果

detailed_translations.english: coming from or existing in the hottest parts of the world

name: wetland
trans: n. 湿地；沼泽地 n. (Wetland)人名；(德)韦特兰

detailed_translations.chinese: 潮湿的土壤, 沼泽地
detailed_translations.english: an area of land that is partly covered with water, or is wet most of the time

name: coniferous
trans: adj. 结球果的；松柏科的

name: deciduous
trans: adj. 落叶性的，脱落性的；非永久性的

sentences.english: Deciduous antlers; deciduous leaves; deciduous teeth .
sentences.chinese: 脱落的鹿角；落叶；脱落的牙齿。

detailed_translations.chinese: 非永久的； 短暂的； 脱落的； 落叶的
detailed_translations.english: deciduous trees lose their leaves in winter

name: budding
trans: adj. 萌芽的；发育期的 n. 发芽

name: clone
trans: n. 克隆；无性系；无性繁殖；靠营养生殖而由母体分离繁殖的植物 vt. 无性繁殖，复制

sentences.english: The idea of cloning extinct life forms still belongs to science fiction.
sentences.chinese: 对绝种的生命形式进行克隆的想法仍然属于科学幻想。

detailed_translations.english: to make an exact copy of a plant or animal by taking a cell from it and developing it artificially

detailed_translations.chinese: 无性繁殖系，克隆；复制品，翻版
detailed_translations.english: an animal or plant produced by scientists from one cell of another animal or plant, so that they are exactly the same

name: invertebrate
trans: adj. 无脊椎的；无骨气的 n. 无脊椎动物；无骨气的人

sentences.english: Concept artist Terryl Whitlatch wanted the colo claw fish to have an invertebrate look, so her early designs were based on an earwig.
sentences.chinese: 概念画家特丽尔·惠特拉奇希望科洛爪鱼拥有无脊椎动物的外表，所以她的早期设计是以蠼螋为基础的。

sentences.english: There was a hierarchical system in neurobiology, and working in invertebrate animals was not looked upon favorably, except in a very special case: the squid giant axon.
sentences.chinese: 神经生物学中有一个等级系统，无脊椎动物的研究不被看好，除了非常特殊的例子：枪乌贼巨大的轴突。

sentences.english: Smithers, don't you think it's ironic that your irregular night-time activities are in inverse proportion to your reputation as an expert in the area of invertebrate research?
sentences.chinese: 斯密德斯，难道你不认为自己无规律的夜生活与你作为无脊椎动物研究领域的专家的声望成反比是具有讽刺意味的吗？

detailed_translations.english: a living creature that does not have a  backbone

name: medusa
trans: n. 水母；水母体

name: polyp
trans: n. 息肉；珊瑚虫；水螅虫

name: tentacle
trans: n. 触手，[动] 触须，[动] 触角

sentences.english: Free speech is being gradually eroded year after year by new tentacles of government control.
sentences.chinese: 言论自由正被政府控制的新触角逐渐侵蚀。

detailed_translations.english: one of the long thin parts of a sea creature such as an  octopus  which it uses for holding things
